Arberry.verse 2:25: Give thou good tidings to those who believe and do deeds of righteousness, that for them await gardens underneath which rivers flow; whensoever they are provided with fruits therefrom they shall say, ’This is that wherewithal we were provided before’; that they shall be given in perfect semblance; and there for them shall be spouses purified; therein they shall dwell forever.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 2:26: God is not ashamed to strike a similitude even of a gnat, or aught above it.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 2:27: such as break the covenant of God after its solemn binding, and such as cut what God has commanded should be joined, and such as do corruption in the land -- they shall be the losers.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 2:28: How do you disbelieve in God, seeing you were dead and He gave you life, then He shall make you dead, then He shall give you life, then unto Him you shall be returned?
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 2:29: It is He who created for you all that is in the earth, then He lifted Himself to heaven and levelled them seven heavens; and He has knowledge of everything.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 2:30: And when thy Lord said to the angels, ’I am setting in the earth a viceroy.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 2:31: And He taught Adam the names, all of them; then He presented them unto the angels and said, ’Now tell Me the names of these, if you speak truly.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 2:32: They said, ’Glory be to Thee! We know not save what Thou hast taught us.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 2:33: He said, ’Adam, tell them their names.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 2:34: And when We said to the angels, ’Bow yourselves to Adam’; so they bowed themselves, save Iblis; he refused, and waxed proud, and so he became one of the unbelievers.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 2:35: And We said, ’Adam, dwell thou, and thy wife, in the Garden, and eat thereof easefully where you desire; but draw not nigh this tree, lest you be evildoers.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 2:36: Then Satan caused them to slip therefrom and brought them out of that they were in; and We said, ’Get you all down, each of you an enemy of each; and in the earth a sojourn shall be yours, and enjoyment for a time.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 2:37: Thereafter Adam received certain words from his Lord, and He turned towards him; truly He turns, and is All-compassionate.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 2:38: We said, ’Get you down out of it, all together; yet there shall come to you guidance from Me, and whosoever follows My guidance, no fear shall be on them, neither shall they sorrow.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 2:39: As for the unbelievers who cry lies to Our signs, those shall be the inhabitants of the Fire, therein dwelling forever.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 2:40: Children of Israel, remember My blessing wherewith I blessed you, and fulfil My covenant and I shall fulfil your covenant; and have awe of Me.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 2:41: And believe in that I have sent down, confirming that which is with you, and be not the first to disbelieve in it.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 2:42: And do not confound the truth with vanity, and do not conceal the truth wittingly.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 2:43: And perform the prayer, and pay the alms, and bow with those that bow.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 2:44: Will you bid others to piety, and forget yourselves while you recite the Book? Do you not understand?
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 2:45: Seek you help in patience and prayer, for grievous it is, save to the humble
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 2:46: who reckon that they shall meet their Lord and that unto Him they are returning.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 2:47: Children of Israel, remember My blessing wherewith I blessed you, and that I have preferred you above all beings;
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 2:48: and beware of a day when no soul for another shall give satisfaction, and no intercession shall be accepted from it, nor any counterpoise be taken, neither shall they be helped.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 2:49: And when We delivered you from the folk of Pharaoh who were visiting you with evil chastisement, slaughtering your sons, and sparing your women; and in that was a grievous trial from your Lord.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 2:50: And when We divided for you the sea and delivered you, and drowned Pharaoh’s folk while you were beholding.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 2:51: And when We appointed with Moses forty nights then you took to yourselves the Calf after him and you were evildoers;
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 2:52: then We pardoned you after that, that haply you should be thankful.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 2:53: And when We gave to Moses the Book and the Salvation, that haply you should be guided.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 2:54: And when Moses said to his people, ’My people, you have done wrong against yourselves by your taking the Calf; now turn to your Creator and slay one another.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 2:55: And when you said, ’Moses, we will not believe thee till we see God openly’; and the thunderbolt took you while you were beholding.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 2:56: Then We raised you up after you were dead, that haply you should be thankful.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 2:57: And We outspread the cloud to overshadow you, and We sent down manna and quails upon you: ’Eat of the good things wherewith We have provided you.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 2:58: And when We said, ’Enter this township, and eat easefully of it wherever you will, and enter in at the gate, prostrating, and say, Unburdening; We will forgive you your transgressions, and increase the good-doers.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 2:59: Then the evildoers substituted a saying other than that which had been said to them; so We sent down upon the evildoers wrath out of heaven for their ungodliness.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 2:60: And when Moses sought water for his people, so We said, ’Strike with thy staff the rock’; and there gushed forth from it twelve fountains; all the people knew now their drinking-place.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 2:61: And when you said, ’Moses, we will not endure one sort of food; pray to thy Lord for us, that He may bring forth for us of that the earth produces - green herbs, cucumbers, corn, lentils, onions.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 2:62: Surely they that believe, and those of Jewry, and the Christians, and those Sabaeans, whoso believes in God and the Last Day, and works righteousness -- their wage awaits them with their Lord, and no fear shall be on them; neither shall they sorrow.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 2:63: And when We took compact with you, and raised above you the Mount: ’Take forcefully what We have given you, and remember what is in it; haply you shall be godfearing.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 2:64: Then you turned away thereafter, and but for the bounty and mercy of God towards you, you had been of the losers.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 2:65: And well you know there were those among you that transgressed the Sabbath, and We said to them, ’Be you apes, miserably slinking!’
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 2:66: And We made it a punishment exemplary for all the former times and for the latter, and an admonition to such as are godfearing.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 2:67: And when Moses said to his people, ’God commands you to sacrifice a cow.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 2:68: They said, ’Pray to thy Lord for us, that He may make clear to us what she may be.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 2:69: They said, ’Pray to thy Lord for us, that He make clear to us what her colour may be.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 2:70: They said, ’Pray to thy Lord for us, that He make clear to us what she may be; cows are much alike to us; and, if God will, we shall then be guided.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 2:71: He said, ’He says she shall be a cow not broken to plough the earth or to water the tillage, one kept secure, with no blemish on her.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 2:72: And when you killed a living soul, and disputed thereon -- and God disclosed what you were hiding --
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 2:73: so We said, ’Smite him with part of it’; even so God brings to life the dead, and He shows you His signs, that haply you may have understanding.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 2:74: Then your hearts became hardened thereafter and are like stones, or even yet harder; for there are stones from which rivers come gushing, and others split, so that water issues from them, and others crash down in the fear of God.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 2:75: Are you then so eager that they should believe you, seeing there is a party of them that heard God’s word, and then tampered with it, and that after they had comprehended it, wittingly?
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 2:76: And when they meet those who believe, they say ’We believe’; and when they go privily one to another, they say, ’Do you speak to them of what God has revealed to you, that they may thereby dispute with you before your Lord? Have you no understanding?’
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 2:77: Know they not that God knows what they keep secret and what they publish?
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 2:78: And some there are of them that are common folk not knowing the Book, but only fancies and mere conjectures.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 2:79: So woe to those who write the Book with their hands, then say, ’This is from God,’ that they may sell it for a little price; so woe to them for what their hands have written, and woe to them for their earnings.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 2:80: And they say, ’The Fire shall not touch us save a number of days.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 2:81: Not so; whoso earns evil, and is encompassed by his transgression -- those are the inhabitants of the Fire; there they shall dwell forever.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 2:82: And those that believe, and do deeds of righteousness -- those are the inhabitants of Paradise; there they shall dwell forever.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 2:83: And when We took compact with the Children of Israel: ’You shall not serve any save God; and to be good to parents, and the near kinsman, and to orphans, and to the needy; and speak good to men, and perform the prayer, and pay the alms.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 2:84: And when We took compact with you: ’You shall not shed your own blood, neither expel your own from your habitations’; then you confirmed it and yourselves bore witness.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 2:85: Then there you are killing one another, and expelling a party of you from their habitations, conspiring against them in sin and enmity; and if they come to you as captives, you ransom them; yet their expulsion was forbidden you.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 2:86: Those who have purchased the present life at the price of the world to come -- for them the chastisement shall not be lightened, neither shall they be helped.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 2:87: And We gave to Moses the Book, and after him sent succeeding Messengers; and We gave Jesus son of Mary the clear signs, and confirmed him with the Holy Spirit; and whensoever there came to you a Messenger with that your souls had not desire for, did you become arrogant, and some cry lies to, and some slay?
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 2:88: And they say, ’Our hearts are uncircumcised.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 2:89: When there came to them a Book from God, confirming what was with them -- and they aforetimes prayed for victory over the unbelievers -- when there came to them that they recognized, they disbelieved in it; and the curse of God is on the unbelievers.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 2:90: Evil is the thing they have sold themselves for, disbelieving in that which God sent down, grudging that God should send down of His bounty on whomsoever He will of His servants, and they were laden with anger upon anger; and for unbelievers awaits a humbling chastisement.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 2:91: And when they were told, ’Believe in that God has sent down,’ they said, ’We believe in what was sent down on us’; and they disbelieve in what is beyond that, yet it is the truth confirming what is with them.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 2:92: And Moses came to you with the clear signs, then you took to yourselves the Calf after him and you were evildoers.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 2:93: And when We took compact with you, and raised over you the Mount: ’Take forcefully what We have given you and give ear.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 2:94: Say: ’If the Last Abode with God is yours exclusively, and not for other people, then long for death -- if you speak truly.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 2:95: But they will never long for it, because of that their hands have forwarded; God knows the evildoers;
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 2:96: and thou shalt find them the eagerest of men for life.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 2:97: Say: ’Whosoever is an enemy to Gabriel -- he it was that brought it down upon thy heart by the leave of God, confirming what was before it, and for a guidance and good tidings to the believers.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 2:98: Whosoever is an enemy to God and His angels and His Messengers, and Gabriel, and Michael - surely God is an enemy to the unbelievers.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 2:99: And We have sent down unto thee signs, clear signs, and none disbelieves in them except the ungodly.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 2:100: Why, whensoever they have made a covenant, does a party of them reject it? Nay, but the most of them are unbelievers.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 2:101: When there has come to them a Messenger from God confirming what was with them, a party of them that were given the Book reject the Book of God behind their backs, as though they knew not,
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 2:102: and they follow what the Satans recited over Solomon’s kingdom.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 2:103: Yet had they believed, and been godfearing, a recompense from God had been better, if they had but known.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 2:104: O believers, do not say, ’Observe us,’ but say, ’Regard us’; and give ear; for unbelievers awaits a painful chastisement.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 2:105: Those unbelievers of the People of the Book and the idolaters wish not that any good should be sent down upon you from your Lord; but God singles out for His mercy whom He will; God is of bounty abounding.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 2:106: And for whatever verse We abrogate or cast into oblivion, We bring a better or the like of it; knowest thou not that God is powerful over everything?
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 2:107: Knowest thou not that to God belongs the kingdom of the heavens and the earth, and that you have none, apart from God, neither protector nor helper?
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 2:108: Or do you desire to question your Messenger as Moses was questioned in former time? Whoso exchanges belief for unbelief has surely strayed from the right way.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 2:109: Many of the People of the Book wish they might restore you as unbelievers, after you have believed, in the jealousy of their souls, after the truth has become clear to them; yet do you pardon and be forgiving, till God brings His command; truly God is powerful over everything.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 2:110: And perform the prayer, and pay the alms; whatever good you shall forward to your souls’ account, you shall find it with God; assuredly God sees the things you do.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 2:111: And they say, ’None shall enter Paradise except that they be Jews or Christians.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 2:112: Nay, but whosoever submits his will to God, being a good-doer, his wage is with his Lord, and no fear shall be on them, neither shall they sorrow.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 2:113: The Jews say, ’The Christians stand not on anything’; the Christians say, ’The Jews stand not on anything’; yet they recite the Book.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 2:114: And who does greater evil than he who bars God’s places of worship, so that His Name be not rehearsed in them, and strives to destroy them? Such men might never enter them, save in fear; for them is degradation in the present world, and in the world to come a mighty chastisement.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 2:115: To God belong the East and the West; whithersoever you turn, there is the Face of God; God is All-embracing, All-knowing.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 2:116: And they say, ’God has taken to Him a son.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 2:117: the Creator of the heavens and the earth; and when He decrees a thing, He but says to it ’Be,’ and it is.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 2:118: And they that know not say, ’Why does God not speak to us? Why does a sign not come to us?’ So spoke those before them as these men say; their hearts are much alike.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 2:119: We have sent thee with the truth, good tidings to bear, and warning.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 2:120: Never will the Jews be satisfied with thee, neither the Christians, not till thou followest their religion.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 2:121: Those to whom We have given the Book and who recite it with true recitation, they believe in it; and whoso disbelieves in it, they shall be the losers.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 2:122: Children of Israel, remember My blessing wherewith I blessed you, and that I have preferred you above all beings;
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 2:123: and beware a day when no soul for another shall give satisfaction, and no counterpoise shall be accepted from it, nor any intercession shall be profitable to it, neither shall they be helped.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 2:124: And when his Lord tested Abraham with certain words, and he fulfilled them.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 2:125: And when We appointed the House to be a place of visitation for the people, and a sanctuary, and: ’Take to yourselves Abraham’s station for a place of prayer.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 2:126: And when Abraham said, ’My Lord, make this a land secure, and provide its people with fruits, such of them as believe in God and the Last Day.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 2:127: And when Abraham, and Ishmael with him, raised up the foundations of the House: ’Our Lord, receive this from us; Thou art the All-hearing, the All-knowing;
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 2:128: and, our Lord, make us submissive to Thee, and of our seed a nation submissive to Thee; and show us our holy rites, and turn towards us; surely Thou turnest, and art All-compassionate;
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 2:129: and, our Lord, do Thou send among them a Messenger, one of them, who shall recite to them Thy signs, and teach them the Book and the Wisdom, and purify them; Thou art the All-mighty, the All-wise.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 2:130: Who therefore shrinks from the religion of Abraham, except he be foolish-minded? Indeed, We chose him in the present world, and in the world to come he shall be among the righteous.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 2:131: When his Lord said to him, ’Surrender,’ he said, ’I have surrendered me to the Lord of all Being.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 2:132: And Abraham charged his sons with this and Jacob likewise: ’My sons, God has chosen for you the religion; see that you die not save in surrender.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 2:133: Why, were you witnesses, when death came to Jacob? When he said to his sons, ’What will you serve after me?’ They said, ’We will serve thy God and the God of thy fathers Abraham, Ishmael and Isaac, One God; to Him we surrender.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 2:134: That is a nation that has passed away; there awaits them that they have earned, and there awaits you that you have earned; you shall not be questioned concerning the things they did.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 2:135: And they say, ’Be Jews or Christians and you shall be guided.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 2:136: Say you: ’We believe in God, and in that which has been sent down on us and sent down on Abraham, Ishmael, Isaac and Jacob, and the Tribes, and that which was given to Moses and Jesus and the Prophets, of their Lord; we make no division between any of them, and to Him we surrender.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 2:137: And if they believe in the like of that you believe in, then they are truly guided; but if they turn away, then they are clearly in schism; God will suffice you for them; He is the All-hearing, the All-knowing;
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 2:138: the baptism of God; and who is there that baptizes fairer than God? Him we are serving.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 2:139: Say: ’Would you then dispute with us concerning God, who is our Lord and your Lord? Our deeds belong to us, and to you belong your deeds; Him we serve sincerely.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 2:140: Or do you say, "Abraham, Ishmael, Isaac and Jacob, and the Tribes -- they were Jews, or they were Christians"?’ Say: ’Have you then greater knowledge, or God? And who does greater evil than he who conceals a testimony received from God? And God is not heedless of the things you do.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 2:141: That is a nation that has passed away; there awaits them that they have earned, and there awaits you that you have earned; you shall not be questioned concerning the things they did.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 2:142: The fools among the people will say, ’What has turned them from the direction they were facing in their prayers aforetime?’ Say: "To God belong the East and the West; He guides whomsoever He will to a straight path.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 2:143: Thus We appointed you a midmost nation that you might be witnesses to the people, and that the Messenger might be a witness to you; and We did not appoint the direction thou wast facing, except that We might know who followed the Messenger from him who turned on his heels -- though it were a grave thing save for those whom God has guided; but God would never leave your faith to waste - truly, God is All-gentle with the people, All-compassionate.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 2:144: We have seen thee turning thy face about in the heaven; now We will surely turn thee to a direction that shall satisfy thee.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 2:145: Yet if thou shouldst bring to those that have been given the Book every sign, they will not follow thy direction; thou art not a follower of their direction, neither are they followers of one another’s direction.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 2:146: whom We have given the Book, and they recognize as they recognize their sons, even though there is a party of them conceal the truth and that wittingly.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 2:147: The truth comes from thy Lord; then be not among the doubters.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 2:148: Every man has his direction to which he turns; so be you forward in good works.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 2:149: From whatsoever place thou issuest, turn thy face towards the Holy Mosque; it is the truth from thy Lord.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 2:150: From whatsoever place thou issuest, turn thy face towards the Holy Mosque; and wherever you may be, turn your faces towards it, that the people may not have any argument against you, excepting the evildoers of them; and fear you them not, but fear you Me; and that I may perfect My blessing upon you, and that haply so you may be guided;
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 2:151: as also We have sent among you, of yourselves, a Messenger, to recite Our signs to you and to purify you, and to teach you the Book and the Wisdom, and to teach you that you knew not.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 2:152: So remember Me, and I will remember you; and be thankful to Me; and be you not ungrateful towards Me.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 2:153: O all you who believe, seek you help in patience and prayer; surely God is with the patient.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 2:154: And say not of those slain in God’s way, ’They are dead’; rather they are living, but you are not aware.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 2:155: Surely We will try you with something of fear and hunger, and diminution of goods and lives and fruits; yet give thou good tidings unto the patient
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 2:156: who, when they are visited by an affliction, say, ’Surely we belong to God, and to Him we return’;
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 2:157: upon those rest blessings and mercy from their Lord, and those -- they are the truly guided.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 2:158: Safa and Marwa are among the waymarks of God; so whosoever makes the Pilgrimage to the House, or the Visitation, it is no fault in him to circumambulate them; and whoso volunteers good, God is All-grateful, All-knowing
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 2:159: Those who conceal the clear signs and the guidance that We have sent down, after We have shown them clearly in the Book -- they shall be cursed by God and the cursers,
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 2:160: save such as repent and make amends, and show clearly -- towards them I shall turn; I turn, All-compassionate.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 2:161: But those who disbelieve, and die disbelieving -- upon them shall rest the curse of God and the angels, and of men altogether,
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 2:162: therein dwelling forever; the chastisement shall not be lightened for them; no respite shall be given them.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 2:163: Your God is One God; there is no god but He, the All-merciful, the All-compassionate.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 2:165: Yet there be men who take to themselves compeers apart from God, loving them as God is loved; but those that believe love God more ardently.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 2:166: when those that were followed disown their followers, and they see the chastisement, and their cords are cut asunder,
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 2:167: and those that followed say, ’O if only we might return again and disown them, as they have disowned us!’ Even so God shall show them their works.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 2:168: O men, eat of what is in the earth lawful and good; and follow not the steps of Satan; he is a manifest foe to you.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 2:169: He only commands you to evil and indecency, and that you should speak against God such things as you know not.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 2:170: And when it is said to them, ’Follow what God has sent down,’ they say, ’No; but we will follow such things as we found our fathers doing.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 2:171: The likeness of those who disbelieve is as the likeness of one who shouts to that which hears nothing, save a call and a cry; deaf, dumb, blind -- they do not understand.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 2:172: O believers, eat of the good things wherewith We have provided you, and give thanks to God, if it be Him that you serve.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 2:173: These things only has He forbidden you: carrion, blood, the flesh of swine, what has been hollowed to other than God.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 2:174: Those who conceal what of the Book God has sent down on them, and sell it for a little price - they shall eat naught but the Fire in their bellies; God shall not speak to them on the Day of Resurrection neither purify them; there awaits them a painful chastisement.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 2:175: Those are they that have bought error at the price of guidance, and chastisement at the price of pardon; how patiently they shall endure the Fire!
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 2:176: That, because God has sent down the Book with the truth; and those that are at variance regarding the Book are in wide schism.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 2:177: It is not piety, that you turn your faces to the East and to the West.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 2:178: O believers, prescribed for you is retaliation, touching the slain; freeman for freeman, slave for slave, female for female.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 2:179: In retaliation there is life for you, men possessed of minds; haply you will be godfearing.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 2:180: Prescribed for you, when any of you is visited by death, and he leaves behind some goods, is to make testament in favour of his parents and kinsmen honourably -- an obligation on the godfearing.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 2:181: Then if any man changes it after hearing it, the sin shall rest upon those who change it; surely God is All-hearing, All-knowing.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 2:182: But if any man fears injustice or sin from one making testament, and so makes things right between them, then sin shall not rest upon him; surely God is All-forgiving, All-compassionate.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 2:183: O believers, prescribed for you is the Fast, even as it was prescribed for those that were before you -- haply you will be godfearing --
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 2:184: for days numbered; and if any of you be sick, or if he be on a journey, then a number of other days; and for those who are able to fast, a redemption by feeding a poor man.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 2:185: the month of Ramadan, wherein the Koran was sent down to be a guidance to the people, and as clear signs of the Guidance and the Salvation.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 2:186: And when My servants question thee concerning Me -- I am near to answer the call of the caller, when he calls to Me; so let them respond to Me, and let them believe in Me; haply so they will go aright.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 2:187: Permitted to you, upon the night of the Fast, is to go in to your wives; -- they are a vestment for you, and you are a vestment for them.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 2:188: Consume not your goods between you in vanity; neither proffer it to the judges, that you may sinfully consume a portion of other men’s goods, and that wittingly.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 2:189: They will question thee concerning the new moons.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 2:190: And fight in the way of God with those; who fight with you, but aggress not: God loves not the aggressors.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 2:191: And slay them wherever you come upon them, and expel them from where they expelled you; persecution is more grievous than slaying.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 2:192: but if they give over, surely God is All-forgiving, All-compassionate.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 2:193: Fight them, till there is no persecution and the religion is God’s; then if they give over, there shall be no enmity save for evildoers.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 2:194: The holy month for the holy month; holy things demand retaliation.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 2:195: And expend in the way of God; and cast not yourselves by your own hands into destruction, but be good-doers; God loves the good-doers.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 2:196: Fulfil the Pilgrimage and the Visitation unto God; but if you are prevented, then such offering as may be feasible.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 2:197: The Pilgrimage is in months well-known; whoso undertakes the duty of Pilgrimage in them shall not go in to his womenfolk nor indulge in ungodliness and disputing in the Pilgrimage.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 2:198: It is no fault in you, that you should seek bounty from your Lord; but when you press on from Arafat, then remember God at the Holy Waymark, and remember Him as He has guided you, though formerly you were gone astray.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 2:199: Then press on from where the people press on, and pray for God’s forgiveness; God is All-forgiving, All-compassionate.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 2:200: And when you have performed your holy rites remember God, as you remember your fathers or yet more devoutly.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 2:201: And others there are who say, ’Our Lord, give to us in this world good, and good in the world to come, and guard us against the chastisement of the fire’;
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 2:202: those -- they shall have a portion from what they have earned; and God is swift at the reckoning.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 2:203: And remember God during certain days numbered.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 2:204: And some men there are whose saying upon the present world pleases thee, and such a one calls on God to witness what is in his heart, yet he is most stubborn in altercation,
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 2:205: and when he turns his back, he hastens about the earth, to do corruption there and to destroy the tillage and the stock; and God loves not corruption;
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 2:206: and when it is said to him, ’Fear God’, vainglory seizes him in his sin.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 2:207: But other men there are that sell themselves desiring God’s good pleasure; and God is gentle with His servants.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 2:208: O believers, enter the peace, all of you, and follow not the steps of Satan; he is a manifest foe to you.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 2:209: But if you slip, after the clear signs have come to you, know then that God is All-mighty, All-wise.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 2:210: What do they look for, but that God shall come to them in the cloud -- shadows, and the angels? The matter is determined, and unto God all matters are returned.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 2:211: Ask the Children of Israel how many a clear sign We gave them.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 2:212: Decked out fair to the unbelievers is the present life, and they deride the believers; but those who were godfearing shall be above them on the Resurrection Day; and God provides whomsoever He will without reckoning.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 2:213: The people were one nation; then God sent forth the Prophets, good tidings to bear and warning, and He sent down with them the Book with the truth, that He might decide between the people touching their differences; and only those who had been given it were at variance upon it, after the clear signs had come to them, being insolent one to another; then God guided those who believed to the truth, touching which they were at variance, by His leave; and God guides whomsoever He will to a straight path.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 2:214: Or did you suppose you should enter Paradise without there had come upon you the like of those who passed away before you? They were afflicted by misery and hardship and were so convulsed, that the Messenger and those who believed with him said, ’When comes God’s help?’ Ah, but surely God’s help is nigh.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 2:215: They will question thee concerning what they should expend.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 2:216: Prescribed for you is fighting, though it be hateful to you.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 2:217: They will question thee concerning the holy month, and fighting in it.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 2:218: But the believers, and those who emigrate and struggle in God’s way -- those have hope of God’s compassion; and God is All-forgiving, All-compassionate.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 2:219: They will question thee concerning wine, and arrow-shuffling.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 2:220: in this world, and the world to come.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 2:221: Do not marry idolatresses, until they believe; a believing slavegirl is better than an idolatress, though you may admire her.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 2:222: They will question thee concerning the monthly course.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 2:223: Your women are a tillage for you; so come unto your tillage as you wish, and forward for your souls; and fear God, and know that you shall meet Him.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 2:224: Do not make God a hindrance, through your oaths, to being pious and godfearing, and putting things right between men.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 2:225: God will not take you to task for a slip in your oaths; but He will take you to task for what your hearts have earned; and God is All-forgiving, All-clement.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 2:226: For those who forswear their women a wait of four months; if they revert, God is All-forgiving, All-compassionate;
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 2:227: but if they resolve on divorce, surely God is All-hearing, All-knowing.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 2:228: Divorced women shall wait by themselves for three periods; and it is not lawful for them to hide what God has created in their wombs; if they believe in God and the Last Day.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 2:229: Divorce is twice; then honourable retention or setting free kindly.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 2:230: If he divorces her finally, she shall not be lawful to him after that, until she marries another husband.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 2:231: When you divorce women, and they have reached their term, then retain them honourably or set them free honourably; do not retain them by force, to transgress; whoever does that has wronged himself.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 2:232: When you divorce women, and they have reached their term, do not debar them from marrying their husbands, when they have agreed together honourably.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 2:233: Mothers shall suckle their children two years completely, for such as desire to fulfil the suckling.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 2:234: And those of you who die, leaving wives, they shall wait by themselves for four months and ten nights; when they have reached their term then it is no fault in you what they may do with themselves honourably.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 2:235: There is no fault in you touching the proposal to women you offer, or hide in your hearts; God knows that you will be mindful of them; but do not make troth with them secretly without you speak honourable words.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 2:236: There is no fault in you, if you divorce women while as yet you have not touched them nor appointed any marriage-portion for them; yet make provision for them, the affluent man according to his means, and according to his means the needy man, honourably -- an obligation on the good-doers.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 2:237: And if you divorce them before you have touched them, and you have already appointed for them a marriage-portion, then one-half of what you have appointed, unless it be they make remission, or he makes remission in whose hand is the knot of marriage; yet that you should remit is nearer to godfearing.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 2:238: Be you watchful over the prayers, and the middle prayer; and do you stand obedient to God.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 2:239: And if you are in fear, then afoot or mounted; but when you are secure, then remember God, as He taught you the things that you knew not.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 2:240: And those of you who die, leaving wives, let them make testament for their wives, provision for a year without expulsion; but if they go forth, there is no fault in you what they may do with themselves honourably; God is All-mighty, All-wise.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 2:241: There shall be for divorced women provision honourable -- an obligation on the godfearing.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 2:242: So God makes clear His signs for you; haply you will understand.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 2:243: Hast thou not regarded those who went forth from their habitations in their thousands fearful of death? God said to them, ’Die!’ Then He gave them life.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 2:244: So fight in God’s way, and know that God is All-hearing, All-knowing.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 2:245: Who is he that will lend God a good loan, and He will multiply it for him manifold? God grasps, and outspreads; and unto Him you shall be returned.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 2:246: Hast thou not regarded the Council of the Children of Israel, after Moses, when they said to a Prophet of theirs, ’Raise up for us a king, and we will fight in God’s way.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 2:247: Then their Prophet said to them, ’Verily God has raised up Saul for you as king.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 2:248: And their Prophet said to them, ’The sign of his kingship is that the Ark will come to you, in it a Shechina from your Lord, and a remnant of what the folk of Moses and Aaron’s folk left behind, the angels bearing it.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 2:249: And when Saul went forth with the hosts he said, ’God will try you with a river; whosoever drinks of it is not of me, and whoso tastes it flot, he is of me, saving him who scoops up with his hand.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 2:250: So, when they went forth against Goliath and his hosts, they said, ’Our Lord, pour out upon us patience, and make firm our feet, and give us aid against the people of the unbelievers!’
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 2:251: And they routed them, by the leave of God, and David slew Goliath; and God gave him the kingship, and Wisdom, and He taught him such as He willed.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 2:252: These are the signs of God We recite to thee in truth, and assuredly thou art of the number of the Envoys.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 2:253: And those Messengers, some We have preferred above others; some there are to whom God spoke, and some He raised in rank.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 2:254: O believers, expend of that wherewith We have provided you, before there comes a day wherein shall be neither traffick, nor friendship, nor intercession; and the unbelievers -- they are the evildoers.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 2:255: God there is no god but He, the Living, the Everlasting.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 2:256: No compulsion is there in religion.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 2:257: God is the Protector of the believers; He brings them forth from the shadows into the light.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 2:258: Hast thou not regarded him who disputed with Abraham, concerning his Lord, that God had given him the kingship? When Abraham said, ’My Lord is He who gives life, and makes to die,’ he said, ’I give life, and make to die.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 2:259: Or such as he who passed by a city that was fallen down upon its turrets; he said, ’How shall God give life to this now it is dead?’ So God made him die a hundred years, then He raised him up, saying, ’How long hast thou tarried?’ He said, ’I have tarried a day, or part of a day.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 2:260: And when Abraham said, ’My Lord, show me how Thou wilt give life to the dead,’ He said, ’Why, dost thou not believe?’ ’Yes,’ he said, ’but that my heart may be at rest.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 2:261: The likeness of those who expend their wealth in the way of God is as the likeness of a grain of corn that sprouts seven ears, in every ear a hundred grains.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 2:262: Those who expend their wealth in the way of God then follow not up what they have expended with reproach and injury, their wage is with their Lord, and no fear shall be on them, neither shall they sorrow.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 2:263: Honourable words, and forgiveness, are better than a freewill offering followed by injury; and God is All-sufficient, All-clement.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 2:264: O believers, void not your freewill offerings with reproach and injury, as one who expends of his substance to show off to men and believes not in God and the Last Day.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 2:265: But the likeness of those who expend their wealth, seeking God’s good pleasure, and to confirm themselves, is as the likeness of a garden upon a hill; a torrent smites it and it yields its produce twofold; if no torrent smites it, yet dew; and God sees the things you do.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 2:266: Would any of you wish to have a garden of palms and vines, with rivers flowing beneath it, and all manner of fruit there for him, then old age smites him, and he has seed, but weaklings, then a whirlwind with fire smites it, and it is consumed? So God makes clear the signs to you; haply you will reflect.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 2:267: O believers, expend of the good things you have earned, and of that We have produced for you from the earth, and intend not the corrupt of it for your expending; for you would never take it yourselves, except you closed an eye on it; and know that God is All-sufficient, All-laudable.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 2:268: Satan promises you poverty, and bids you unto indecency; but God promises you His pardon and His bounty; and God is All-embracing, All-knowing.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 2:269: He gives the Wisdom to whomsoever He will, and whoso is given the Wisdom, has been given much good; yet none remembers but men possessed of minds.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 2:270: And whatever expenditure you expend, and whatever vow you vow, surely God knows it.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 2:271: If you publish your freewill offerings, it is excellent; but if you conceal them, and give them to the poor, that is better for you, and will acquit you of your evil deeds; God is aware of the things you do.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 2:272: Thou art not responsible for guiding them; but God guides whomsoever He will.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 2:273: it being for the poor who are restrained in the way of God, and are unable to journey in the land; the ignorant man supposes them rich because of their abstinence, but thou shalt know them by their mark -- they do not beg of men importunately.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 2:274: Those who expend their wealth night and day, secretly and in public, their wage awaits them with their Lord, and no fear shall be on them, neither shall they sorrow.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 2:275: Those who devour usury shall not rise again except as he rises, whom Satan of the touch prostrates; that is because they say, ’Trafficking (trade) is like usury.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 2:276: God blots out usury, but freewill offerings He augments with interest.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 2:277: Those who believe and do deeds of righteousness, and perform the prayer, and pay the alms -- their wage awaits them with their Lord, and no fear shall be on them, neither shall they sorrow.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 2:278: O believers, fear you God; and give up the usury that is outstanding, if you are believers.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 2:279: But if you do not, then take notice that God shall war with you, and His Messenger; yet if you repent, you shall have your principal, unwronging and unwronged.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 2:280: And if any man should be in difficulties, let him have respite till things are easier; but that you should give freewill offerings is better for you, did you but know.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 2:281: And fear a day wherein you shall be returned to God, and every soul shall be paid in full what it has earned; and they shall not be wronged.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 2:282: O believers, when you contract a debt one upon another for a stated term, write it down, and let a writer write it down between you justly, and let not any writer refuse to write it down, as God has taught him; so let him write, and let the debtor dictate, and let him fear God his Lord and not diminish aught of it.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 2:283: And if you are upon a journey, and you do not find a writer, then a pledge in hand.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 2:284: To God belongs all that is in the heavers and earth.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 2:285: The Messenger believes in what was sent down to him from his Lord, and the believers; each one believes in God and His angels, and in His Books and His Messengers; we make no division between any one of His Messengers.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 2:286: God charges no soul save to its capacity; standing to its account is what it has earned, and against its account what it has merited.

Muhammad Asad.verse 2:2: THIS DIVINE WRIT – let there be no doubt about it – is [meant to be] a guidance for all the God-conscious
Muhammad Asad.verse 2:3: who believe in [the existence of] that which is beyond the reach of human perception, and are constant in prayer, and spend on others out of what We provide for them as sustenance;
Muhammad Asad.verse 2:4: and who believe in that which has been bestowed from on high upon thee, [O Prophet,] as well as in that which was bestowed before thy time: for it is they who in their innermost are certain of the life to come!
Muhammad Asad.verse 2:5: It is they who follow the guidance [which comes] from their Sustainer; and it is they, they who shall attain to a happy state!
Muhammad Asad.verse 2:6: BEHOLD, as for those who are bent on denying the truth – it is all one to them whether thou warnest them or dost not warn them: they will not believe.
Muhammad Asad.verse 2:7: God has sealed their hearts and their hearing, and over their eyes is a veil; and awesome suffering awaits them.
Muhammad Asad.verse 2:8: And there are people who say, "We do believe in God and the Last Day," the while they do not
Muhammad Asad.verse 2:10: They would deceive God and those who have attained to faith – the while they deceive none but themselves, and perceive it not.
Muhammad Asad.verse 2:11: In their hearts is disease, and so God lets their disease increase; and grievous suffering awaits them because of their persistent lying.
Muhammad Asad.verse 2:12: And when they are told, "Do not spread corruption on earth," they answer, "We are but improving things!"
Muhammad Asad.verse 2:13: Oh, verily, it is they, they who are spreading corruption – but they perceive it not!
Muhammad Asad.verse 2:14: And when they are told, "Believe as other people believe," they answer, "Shall we believe as the weak-minded believe?" Oh, verily, it is they, they who are weak-minded – but they know it not!
Muhammad Asad.verse 2:15: And when they meet those who have attained to faith, they assert, "We believe [as you believe]"; but when they find themselves alone with their evil impulses, they say, "Verily, we are with you; we were only mocking!"
Muhammad Asad.verse 2:16: God will requite them for their mockery, and will leave them for a while in their overweening arrogance, blindly stumbling to and fro:
Muhammad Asad.verse 2:18: it is they who have taken error in exchange for guidance; and neither has their bargain brought them gain, nor have they found guidance .
Muhammad Asad.verse 2:19: Their parable is that of people who kindle a fire: but as soon as it has illumined all around them, God takes away their light and leaves them in utter darkness, wherein they cannot see:
Muhammad Asad.verse 2:20: deaf, dumb, blind – and they cannot turn back.
Muhammad Asad.verse 2:21: Or [the parable] of a violent cloudburst in the sky, with utter darkness, thunder, and lightning: they put their fingers into their ears to keep out the peals of thunder, in terror of death; but God encompasses [with His might] all who deny the truth.
Muhammad Asad.verse 2:22: The lightning well-nigh takes away their sight; whenever it gives them light, they advance therein, and whenever darkness falls around them, they stand still.
Muhammad Asad.verse 2:23: O MANKIND! Worship your Sustainer, who has created you and those who lived before you, so that you might remain conscious of Him
Muhammad Asad.verse 2:24: who has made the earth a resting-place for you and the sky a canopy, and has sent down water from the sky and thereby brought forth fruits for your sustenance: do not, then, claim that there is any power that could rival God, when you know [that He is One].
Muhammad Asad.verse 2:25: And if you doubt any part of what We have bestowed from on high, step by step, upon Our servant ,
Muhammad Asad.verse 2:26: then produce a sūrah of similar merit, and call upon any other than God to bear witness for you – if what you say is true!
Muhammad Asad.verse 2:27: And if you cannot do it – and most certainly you cannot do it – then be conscious of the fire whose fuel is human beings and stones which awaits all who deny the truth!
Muhammad Asad.verse 2:28: But unto those who have attained to faith and do good works give the glad tiding that theirs shall be gardens through which running waters flow.
Muhammad Asad.verse 2:29: And there shall they have spouses pure, and there shall they abide.
Muhammad Asad.verse 2:30: Behold, God does not disdain to propound a parable of a gnat, or of something
Muhammad Asad.verse 2:32: God mean by this parable?"In this way does He cause many a one to go astray, just as He guides many a one aright: but none does He cause thereby to go astray save the iniquitous,
Muhammad Asad.verse 2:33: who break their bond with God after it has been established [in their nature], and cut asunder what God has bidden to be joined, and spread corruption on earth: these it is that shall be the losers.
Muhammad Asad.verse 2:34: How can you refuse to acknowledge God, seeing that you were lifeless and He gave you life, and that He will cause you to die and then will bring you again to life, whereupon unto Him you will be brought back?
Muhammad Asad.verse 2:35: He it is who has created for you all that is on earth, and has applied His design to the heavens and fashioned them into seven heavens; and He alone has full knowledge of everything.
Muhammad Asad.verse 2:36: AND LO! Thy Sustainer said unto the angels: "Behold, I am about to establish upon earth one who shall inherit it.
Muhammad Asad.verse 2:37: answered: "Verily, I know that which you do not know.
Muhammad Asad.verse 2:38: And He imparted unto Adam the names of all things; then He brought them within the ken of the angels and said: "Declare unto Me the names of these ,
Muhammad Asad.verse 2:39: if what you say is true.
Muhammad Asad.verse 2:40: They replied: "Limitless art Thou in Thy glory! No knowledge have we save that which Thou hast imparted unto us.
Muhammad Asad.verse 2:41: Said He: "O Adam, convey unto them the names of these .
Muhammad Asad.verse 2:43: had conveyed unto them their names,
Muhammad Asad.verse 2:44: said: "Did I not say unto you, ‘Verily, I alone know the hidden reality of the heavens and the earth, and know all that you bring into the open and all that you would conceal’?"
Muhammad Asad.verse 2:45: And when We told the angels, "Prostrate yourselves before Adam!" – they all prostrated themselves, save Iblīs, who refused and gloried in his arrogance: and thus he became one of those who deny the truth.
Muhammad Asad.verse 2:46: And We said: "O Adam, dwell thou and thy wife in this garden, andeat freely thereof, both of you, whatever you may wish; but do not approach this one tree, lest you become wrongdoers.
Muhammad Asad.verse 2:47: But Satan caused them both to stumble therein, and thus brought about the loss of their erstwhile state.
Muhammad Asad.verse 2:48: Thereupon Adam received words [of guidance] from his Sustainer, and He accepted his repentance: for, verily, He alone is the Acceptor of Repentance, the Dispenser of Grace.
Muhammad Asad.verse 2:49: [For although] We did say, "Down with you all from this ,"
Muhammad Asad.verse 2:50: there shall, none the less, most certainly come unto you guidance from Me: and those who follow My guidance need have no fear, and neither shall they grieve;
Muhammad Asad.verse 2:51: but those who are bent on denying the truth and giving the lie to Our messages – they are destined for the fire, and therein shall they abide.
Muhammad Asad.verse 2:52: O CHILDREN of Israel! Remember those blessings of Mine with which I graced you, and fulfil your promise unto Me,
Muhammad Asad.verse 2:53: I shall fulfil My promise unto you; and of Me, of Me stand in awe!
Muhammad Asad.verse 2:54: Believe in that which I have
Muhammad Asad.verse 2:55: bestowed from on high, confirming the truth already in your possession, and be not foremost among those who deny its truth; and do not barter away My messages for a trifling gain; and of Me, of Me be conscious!
Muhammad Asad.verse 2:56: And do not overlay the truth with falsehood, and do not knowingly suppress the truth;
Muhammad Asad.verse 2:57: and be constant in prayer, and spend in charity, and bow down in prayer with all who thus bow down.
Muhammad Asad.verse 2:58: Do you bid other people to be pious, the while you forget your own selves – and yet you recite the divine writ? Will you not, then, use your reason?
Muhammad Asad.verse 2:59: And seek aid in steadfast patience and prayer: and this, indeed, is a hard thing for all but the humble in spirit,
Muhammad Asad.verse 2:60: who know with certainty that they shall meet their Sustainer and that unto Him they shall return.
Muhammad Asad.verse 2:61: O children of Israel! Remember those blessings of Mine with which I graced you, and how I favoured you above all other people;
Muhammad Asad.verse 2:62: and remain conscious of [the coming of] a Day when no human being shall in the least avail another, nor shall intercession be accepted from any of them, nor ransom taken from them, and none shall be succoured.
Muhammad Asad.verse 2:63: And [remember the time] when We saved you from Pharaoh’s people, who afflicted you with cruel suffering, slaughtering your sons and sparing
Muhammad Asad.verse 2:64: your women – which was an awesome trial from your Sustainer;
Muhammad Asad.verse 2:65: and when We cleft the sea before you, and thus saved you and caused Pharaoh’s people to drown before your very eyes;
Muhammad Asad.verse 2:66: and when We appointed for Moses forty nights [on Mount Sinai], and in his absence you took to worshipping the
Muhammad Asad.verse 2:68: yet, even after that, We blotted out this your sin, so that you might have cause to be grateful.
Muhammad Asad.verse 2:69: And [remember the time] when We vouchsafed unto Moses the divine writ – and
Muhammad Asad.verse 2:70: a standard by which to discern the true from the false – so that you might be guided aright;
Muhammad Asad.verse 2:71: and when Moses said unto his people: "O my people! Verily, you have sinned against yourselves by worshipping the calf; turn, then, in repentance to your Maker and mortify yourselves; this will be the best for you in your Maker’s sight.
Muhammad Asad.verse 2:73: when you said, "O Moses, indeed we shall not believe thee until we see God face to face!" – whereupon the thunderbolt of punishment overtook you before your very eyes.
Muhammad Asad.verse 2:74: But We raised you again after you had been as dead, so that you might have cause to be grateful.
Muhammad Asad.verse 2:75: And We caused the clouds to comfort you with their shade, and sent down unto you manna and quails,
Muhammad Asad.verse 2:76: "Partake of the good things which We have provided for you as sustenance.
Muhammad Asad.verse 2:77: against their own selves did they sin.
Muhammad Asad.verse 2:78: And [remember the time] when We said: "Enter this land, and eat of its food as you may desire, abundantly; but enter the gate humbly and say, ‘Remove Thou from us the burden of our sins’,
Muhammad Asad.verse 2:79: We shall forgive you your sins, and shall amply reward the doers of good.
Muhammad Asad.verse 2:80: But those who were bent on evildoing substituted another saying for that which had been given them: and so We sent down upon those evildoers a plague from heaven in requital for all their iniquity.
Muhammad Asad.verse 2:82: when Moses prayed for water for his people and We replied, "Strike the rock with thy staff!" – whereupon twelve springs gushed forth from it, so that all the people knew whence to drink.
Muhammad Asad.verse 2:84: when you said: "O Moses, indeed we cannot endure but one kind of food; pray, then, to thy Sustainer that He bring forth for us aught of what grows from the earth – of its herbs, its cucumbers, its garlic, its lentils, its onions.
Muhammad Asad.verse 2:85: "Would you take a lesser thing in exchange for what is [so much] better? Go back in shame to Egypt, and then you can have what you are asking for!" And so, ignominy and humiliation overshadowed them, and they earned the burden of God’s condemnation: all this, because they persisted in denying the truth of God’s messages and in slaying the prophets against all right: all this, because they rebelled [against God], and persisted in transgressing the bounds of what is right.
Muhammad Asad.verse 2:86: VERILY, those who have attained to faith [in this divine writ], as well as those who follow the Jewish faith, and the Christians, and the Sabians – all who believe in God and the Last Day and do righteous deeds – shall have their reward with their Sustainer; and no fear need they have, and neither shall they grieve.
Muhammad Asad.verse 2:87: AND LO! We accepted your solemn pledge, raising Mount Sinai high above you, [and saying,] "Hold fast with [all your] strength unto what We have vouchsafed you, and bear in mind all that is therein, so that you might remain conscious of God!"
Muhammad Asad.verse 2:88: And you turned away after that! And had it not been for God’s favour upon you and His grace, you would surely have found yourselves among the lost;
Muhammad Asad.verse 2:89: for you are well aware of those from among you who profaned the Sabbath, whereupon We said unto them, "Be as apes despicable!" –
Muhammad Asad.verse 2:90: and set them up as a warning example for their time and for all times to come, as well as an admonition to all who are conscious of God.
Muhammad Asad.verse 2:91: AND LO! Moses said unto his people: "Behold, God bids you to sacrifice a cow.
Muhammad Asad.verse 2:92: Said they: "Pray on our behalf unto thy Sustainer that He make clear to us what she is to be like.
Muhammad Asad.verse 2:93: replied: "Behold, He says it is to be a cow neither old nor immature, but of an age in-between.
Muhammad Asad.verse 2:94: Said they: "Pray on our behalf unto thy Sustainer that He make clear to us what her colour should be.
Muhammad Asad.verse 2:95: answered: "Behold, He says it is to be a yellow cow, bright of hue, pleasing to the beholder.
Muhammad Asad.verse 2:96: Said they: "Pray on our behalf unto thy Sustainer that He make clear to us what she is to be like, for to us all cows resemble one another; and then, if God so wills, we shall truly be guided aright!"
Muhammad Asad.verse 2:98: answered: "Behold, He says it is to be a cow not broken-in to plough the earth or to water the crops, free of fault, without markings of any other colour.
Muhammad Asad.verse 2:99: For, [O children of Israel,] because you had slain a human being and then cast the blame for this
Muhammad Asad.verse 2:100: upon one another – although God will bring to light what you would conceal –
Muhammad Asad.verse 2:102: to some of those [cases of unresolved murder]: in this way God saves lives from death and shows you His will, so that you might [learn to] use your reason.
Muhammad Asad.verse 2:103: And yet, after all this, your hearts hardened and became like rocks, or even harder: for, behold, there are rocks from which streams gush forth; and, behold, there are some from which, when they are cleft, water issues; and, behold, there are some that fall down for awe of God.
Muhammad Asad.verse 2:104: CAN YOU, then, hope that they will believe in what you are preaching – seeing that a good many of them were wont to listen to the word of God and then, after having understood it, to pervert it knowingly?
Muhammad Asad.verse 2:105: For, when they meet those who have attained to faith, they say, "We believe [as you believe]" – but when they find themselves alone with one another, they say, "Do you inform them of what God has disclosed to you, so that they might use it in argument against you, quoting the words of your Sustainer? Will you not, then, use your reason?"
Muhammad Asad.verse 2:106: Do they not know, then, that God is aware of all that they would conceal as well as of all that they bring into the open?
Muhammad Asad.verse 2:107: And there are among them unlettered people who have no real knowledge of the divine writ,
Muhammad Asad.verse 2:108: only wishful beliefs and depending on nothing but conjecture.
Muhammad Asad.verse 2:109: Woe, then, unto those who write down, with their own hands, [something which they claim to be] divine writ, and then say, "This is from God," in order to acquire a trifling gain thereby; woe, then, unto them for what their hands have written, and woe unto them for all that they may have gained!
Muhammad Asad.verse 2:110: And they say, "The fire will most certainly not touch us for more than a limited number of days.
Muhammad Asad.verse 2:111: Yea! Those who earn evil and by their sinfulness are engulfed – they are destined for the fire, therein to abide;
Muhammad Asad.verse 2:112: whereas those who attain to faith and do righteous deeds – they are destined for paradise, therein to abide.
Muhammad Asad.verse 2:113: AND LO! We accepted this solemn pledge from
Muhammad Asad.verse 2:114: the children of Israel: "You shall worship none but God; and you shall do good unto your parents and kinsfolk, and the orphans, and the poor; and you shall speak unto all people in a kindly way; and you shall be constant in prayer; and you shall spend in charity.
Muhammad Asad.verse 2:115: And lo! We accepted your solemn pledge that you would not shed one another’s blood, and would not drive one another from your homelands – whereupon you acknowledged it; and thereto you bear witness [even now].
Muhammad Asad.verse 2:116: And yet, it is you who slay one another and drive some of your own people from their homelands, aiding one another against them in sin and hatred; but if they come to you as captives, you ransom them – although the very [act of] driving them away has been made unlawful to you! Do you, then, believe in some parts of the divine writ and deny the truth of other parts? What, then, could be the reward of those among you who do such things but ignominy in the life of this world and, on the Day of Resurrection, commitment to most grievous suffering? For God is not unmindful of what you do.
Muhammad Asad.verse 2:117: All who buy the life of this world at the price of the life to come – their suffering shall not be lightened, nor shall they be succoured!
Muhammad Asad.verse 2:118: For, indeed, We vouchsafed unto Moses the divine writ and caused apostle after apostle to follow him; and We vouchsafed unto Jesus, the son of Mary, all evidence of the truth, and strengthened him with holy inspiration.
Muhammad Asad.verse 2:119: is it not so that every time an apostle came unto you with something that was not to your liking, you gloried in your arrogance, and to some of them you gave the lie, while others you would slay?
Muhammad Asad.verse 2:120: But they say, "Our hearts are already full of knowledge.
Muhammad Asad.verse 2:121: And whenever there came unto them a
Muhammad Asad.verse 2:122: revelation from God, confirming the truth already in their possession – and [bear in mind that] aforetime they used to pray for victory over those who were bent on denying the truth – whenever there came unto them something which they recognized [as the truth], they would deny it.
Muhammad Asad.verse 2:123: Vile is that [false pride] for which they have sold their own selves by denying the truth of what God has bestowed from on high, out of envy that God should bestow aught of His favour upon whomsoever He wills of His servants: and thus have they earned the burden of God’s condemnation, over and over.
Muhammad Asad.verse 2:124: For when they are told, "Believe in what God has bestowed from on high," they reply, "We believe
Muhammad Asad.verse 2:125: in what has been bestowed on us" – and they deny the truth of everything else, although it be a truth confirming the one already in their possession.
Muhammad Asad.verse 2:127: And indeed, there came unto you Moses with all evidence of the truth – and thereupon, in his absence, you took to worshipping the
Muhammad Asad.verse 2:129: And, lo, We accepted your solemn pledge, raising Mount Sinai high above you,
Muhammad Asad.verse 2:130: "Hold fast with [all your] strength unto what We have vouchsafed you, and hearken unto it!"
Muhammad Asad.verse 2:131: they say, "We have heard, but we disobey" – for their hearts are filled to overflowing with love of the
Muhammad Asad.verse 2:132: calf because of their refusal to acknowledge the truth.
Muhammad Asad.verse 2:133: belief of yours enjoins upon you – if indeed you are believers!"
Muhammad Asad.verse 2:134: Say: "If an afterlife with God is to be for you alone, to the exclusion of all other people, then you should long for death – if what you say is true!"
Muhammad Asad.verse 2:135: But never will they long for it, because [they are aware] of what their hands have sent ahead in this world: and God has full knowledge of evildoers.
Muhammad Asad.verse 2:136: And thou wilt most certainly find that they cling to life more eagerly than any other people, even more than those who are bent on ascribing divinity to other beings beside God: every one of them would love to live a thousand years, although the grant of long life could not save him from suffering [in the hereafter]: for God sees all that they do.
Muhammad Asad.verse 2:137: SAY [O Prophet]: "Whosoever is an enemy of Gabriel" – who, verily, by God’s leave, has brought down upon thy heart this [divine writ] which confirms the truth of whatever there still remains [of earlier revelations], and is a guidance and a glad tiding for the believers –
Muhammad Asad.verse 2:138: "whosoever is an enemy of God and His angels and His message-bearers, including Gabriel and Michael, [should know that,] verily, God is the enemy of all who deny the truth.
Muhammad Asad.verse 2:139: For clear messages indeed have We bestowed upon thee from on high; and none denies their truth save the iniquitous.
Muhammad Asad.verse 2:140: Is it not so that every time they made a promise [unto God], some of them cast it aside? Nay, indeed: most of them do not believe.
Muhammad Asad.verse 2:141: And [even now,] when there has come unto them an apostle from God, confirming the truth already in their possession, some of those who were granted revelation aforetime cast the divine writ behind their backs as though unaware [of what it says],
Muhammad Asad.verse 2:143: that which the evil ones used to practice during Solomon’s reign – for it was not Solomon who denied the truth, but those evil ones denied it by teaching people sorcery – and [they follow] that which has come down through the two angels in Babylon, Hārūt and Mārūt – although these two never taught it to anyone without first declaring, "We are but a temptation to evil: do not, then, deny
Muhammad Asad.verse 2:144: truth!" And they learn from these two how to create discord between a man and his wife; but whereas they can harm none thereby save by God’s leave, they acquire a knowledge that only harms themselves and does not benefit them – although they know, indeed, that he who acquires this
Muhammad Asad.verse 2:145: shall have no share in the good of the life to come.
Muhammad Asad.verse 2:146: for which they have sold their own selves – had they but known it!
Muhammad Asad.verse 2:147: And had they but believed and been conscious of Him, reward from God would indeed have brought them good – had they but known it!
Muhammad Asad.verse 2:148: O YOU who have attained to faith! Do not say [to the Prophet], "Listen to us," but rather say, "Have patience with us," and hearken [unto him], since grievous suffering awaits those who deny the truth.
Muhammad Asad.verse 2:149: Neither those from among the followers of earlier revelation who are bent on denying the truth, nor those who ascribe divinity to other beings beside God, would like to see any good ever bestowed upon you from on high by your Sustainer; but God singles out for His grace whom He wills – for God is limitless in His great bounty.
Muhammad Asad.verse 2:150: Any message which We annul or consign to oblivion We replace with a better or a similar one.
Muhammad Asad.verse 2:151: Dost thou not know that God’s is the dominion over the heavens and the earth, and that besides God you have none to protect you or bring you succour?
Muhammad Asad.verse 2:152: Would you, perchance, ask of the Apostle who has been sent unto you what was asked aforetime of Moses? But whoever chooses to deny the [evidence of the] truth, instead of believing in it, has already strayed from the right path.
Muhammad Asad.verse 2:153: Out of their selfish envy, many among the followers of earlier revelation would like to bring you back to denying the truth after you have attained to faith –
Muhammad Asad.verse 2:154: after the truth has become clear unto them.
Muhammad Asad.verse 2:155: And be constant in prayer, and render the purifying dues; for whatever good deed you send ahead for your own selves, you shall find it with God: behold, God sees all that you do.
Muhammad Asad.verse 2:156: AND THEY claim, "None shall ever enter paradise unless he be a Jew" – or, "a Christian.
Muhammad Asad.verse 2:157: Yea, indeed: everyone who surrenders his whole being unto God, and is a doer of good withal, shall have his reward with his Sustainer; and all such need have no fear, and neither shall they grieve.
Muhammad Asad.verse 2:158: Furthermore, the Jews assert, "The Christians have no valid ground for their beliefs," while the Christians assert, "The Jews have no valid ground for their beliefs" – and both quote the divine writ! Even thus, like unto what they say, have
Muhammad Asad.verse 2:159: spoken those who were devoid of knowledge; but it is God who will judge between them on Resurrection Day with regard to all on which they were wont to differ.
Muhammad Asad.verse 2:160: Hence, who could be more wicked than those who bar the mention of God’s name from [any of] His houses of worship and strive for their ruin,
Muhammad Asad.verse 2:161: they have no right to enter them save in fear [of God]? For them, in this world, there is ignominy in store; and for them, in the life to come, awesome suffering.
Muhammad Asad.verse 2:162: And God’s is the east and the west: and wherever you turn, there is God’s countenance.
Muhammad Asad.verse 2:163: And yet some people assert, "God has taken unto Himself a son!" Limitless is He in His glory! Nay, but His is all that is in the heavens and on earth; all things devoutly obey His will.
Muhammad Asad.verse 2:164: The Originator is He of the heavens and the earth: and when He wills a thing to be, He but says unto it, "Be" – and it is.
Muhammad Asad.verse 2:166: those who are devoid of knowledge say, "Why does God not speak unto us, nor is a
Muhammad Asad.verse 2:167: sign shown to us?" Even thus, like unto what they say, spoke those who lived before their time: their hearts are all alike.
Muhammad Asad.verse 2:168: Verily, We have sent thee [O Prophet] with the truth, as a bearer of glad tidings and a warner: and thou shalt not be held accountable for those who are destined for the blazing fire.
Muhammad Asad.verse 2:169: For never will the Jews be pleased with thee, nor yet the Christians, unless thou follow their own creeds.
Muhammad Asad.verse 2:170: Those unto whom We have vouchsafed the divine writ [and who] follow it as it ought to be followed – it is they who
Muhammad Asad.verse 2:171: believe in it; whereas all who choose to deny its truth – it is they, they who are the losers!
Muhammad Asad.verse 2:172: O CHILDREN of Israel! Remember those blessings of Mine with which I graced you, and how I favoured you above all other people;
Muhammad Asad.verse 2:173: and remain conscious of [the coming of] a Day when no human being shall in the least avail another, nor shall ransom be accepted from any of them, nor shall intercession be of any use to them, and none shall be succoured.
Muhammad Asad.verse 2:174: And [remember this:] when his Sustainer tried Abraham by
Muhammad Asad.verse 2:175: commandments and the latter fulfilled them, He said: "Behold, I shall make thee a leader of men.
Muhammad Asad.verse 2:176: answered: "My covenant does not embrace the evildoers.
Muhammad Asad.verse 2:177: AND LO! We made the Temple a goal to which people might repair again and again, and a sanctuary: take, then, the place whereon Abraham once stood as your place of prayer.
Muhammad Asad.verse 2:178: And, lo, Abraham prayed: "O my Sustainer! Make this a land secure, and grant its people fruitful sustenance – such of them as believe in God and the Last Day.
Muhammad Asad.verse 2:179: answered: "And whoever shall deny the truth, him will I let enjoy himself for a short while – but in the end I shall drive him to suffering through fire: and how vile a journey’s end!"
Muhammad Asad.verse 2:180: And when Abraham and Ishmael were raising the foundations of the Temple, [they prayed:] "O our Sustainer! Accept Thou this from us: for, verily, Thou alone art all-hearing, all-knowing!
Muhammad Asad.verse 2:181: "O our Sustainer! Make us surrender ourselves unto Thee, and make out of our offspring a community that shall surrender itself unto Thee, and show us our ways of worship, and accept our repentance: for, verily, Thou alone art the Acceptor of Repentance, the Dispenser of Grace!
Muhammad Asad.verse 2:182: "O our Sustainer! Raise up from the midst of our offspring an apostle from among themselves, who shall convey unto them Thy messages, and impart unto them revelation as well as wisdom, and cause them to grow in purity: for, verily, Thou alone art almighty, truly wise!"
Muhammad Asad.verse 2:183: And who, unless he be weak of mind, would want to abandon Abraham’s creed, seeing that We have indeed raised him high in this world, and that, verily, in the life to come he shall be among the righteous?
Muhammad Asad.verse 2:184: When his Sustainer said to him, "Surrender thyself unto Me!" – he answered, "I have surrendered myself unto
Muhammad Asad.verse 2:185: the Sustainer of all the worlds.
Muhammad Asad.verse 2:186: And this very thing did Abraham bequeath unto his children, and [so did] Jacob: "O my children! Behold, God has granted you the purest faith; so do not allow death to overtake you ere you have surrendered yourselves unto Him.
Muhammad Asad.verse 2:187: Nay, but you [yourselves, O children of Israel,] bear witness that when death was approaching Jacob, he said unto his sons: "Whom will you worship after I am gone?" They answered: "We will worship thy God, the God of thy forefathers Abraham and Ishmael and Isaac, the One God; and unto Him will we surrender ourselves.
Muhammad Asad.verse 2:188: Now those people have passed away; unto them shall be accounted what they have earned, and unto you, what you have earned; and you will not be judged on the strength of what they did.
Muhammad Asad.verse 2:189: AND THEY say, "Be Jews" – or, "Christians" – "and you shall be on the right path.
Muhammad Asad.verse 2:190: Say: "We believe in God, and in that which has been bestowed from on high upon us, and that which has been bestowed upon Abraham and Ishmael and Isaac and Jacob and their descendants, and that which has been vouchsafed to Moses and Jesus, and that which has been vouchsafed to all the
Muhammad Asad.verse 2:191: prophets by their Sustainer: we make no distinction between any of them.
Muhammad Asad.verse 2:193: come to believe in the way you believe, they will indeed find themselves on the right path; and if they turn away, it is but they who will be deeply in the wrong, and God will protect thee from them: for He alone is all-hearing, all-knowing.
Muhammad Asad.verse 2:194: [Say: "Our life takes its] hue from God! And who could give a better hue [to life] than God, if we but truly worship Him?"
Muhammad Asad.verse 2:195: Say [to the Jews and the Christians]: "Do you argue with us about God? But He is our Sustainer as well as your Sustainer – and unto us shall be accounted our deeds, and unto you, your deeds; and it is unto Him alone that we devote ourselves.
Muhammad Asad.verse 2:196: "Do you claim that Abraham and Ishmael and Isaac and Jacob and their descendants were ‘Jews’ or ‘Christians’?" Say: "Do you know more than God does? And who could be more wicked than he who suppresses a testimony given to him by God? Yet God is not unmindful of what you do.
Muhammad Asad.verse 2:197: "Now those people have passed away; unto them shall be accounted what they have earned, and unto you, what you have earned; and you will not be judged on the strength of what they did.
Muhammad Asad.verse 2:198: THE WEAK-MINDED among people will say, "What has turned them away from the direction of prayer which they have hitherto observed?" Say: "God’s is the east and the west; He guides whom He wills onto a straight way.
Muhammad Asad.verse 2:199: And thus have We willed you to be a community of the middle way, so that [with your lives] you might bear witness to the truth before all mankind, and that the Apostle might bear witness to it before you.
Muhammad Asad.verse 2:200: We have seen thee [O Prophet] often turn thy face towards heaven [for guidance]: and now We shall indeed make thee turn in prayer in a direction which will fulfil thy desire.
Muhammad Asad.verse 2:201: comes in truth from their Sustainer; and God is not unaware of what they do.
