Muhammad Asad.verse 2:202: And yet, even if thou wert to place all evidence before those who have been vouchsafed earlier revelation, they would not follow thy direction of prayer; and neither mayest thou follow their direction of prayer, nor even do they follow one another’s direction.
Muhammad Asad.verse 2:203: They unto whom We have vouchsafed revelation aforetime know it as they know their own children: but, behold, some of them knowingly suppress the truth –
Muhammad Asad.verse 2:204: the truth from thy Sustainer! Be not, then, among the doubters:
Muhammad Asad.verse 2:205: for every community faces a direction of its own, of which He is the focal point.
Muhammad Asad.verse 2:206: Thus, from wherever thou mayest come forth, turn thy face [in prayer] towards the Inviolable House of Worship – for, behold, this
Muhammad Asad.verse 2:207: comes in truth from thy Sustainer; and God is not unaware of what you do.
Muhammad Asad.verse 2:208: Hence, from wherever thou mayest come forth, turn thy face [in prayer] towards the Inviolable House of Worship; and wherever you all may be, turn your faces towards it, so that people should have no argument against you unless they are bent upon wrongdoing.
Muhammad Asad.verse 2:209: Even as We have sent unto you an apostle from among yourselves to convey unto you Our messages, and to cause you to grow in purity, and to impart unto you revelation and wisdom, and to teach you that which you knew not:
Muhammad Asad.verse 2:210: so remember Me, and I shall remember you; and be grateful unto Me, and deny Me not.
Muhammad Asad.verse 2:211: O YOU who have attained to faith! Seek aid in steadfast patience and prayer: for, behold, God is with those who are patient in adversity.
Muhammad Asad.verse 2:212: And say not of those who are slain in God’s cause, "They are dead": nay, they are alive, but you perceive it not.
Muhammad Asad.verse 2:213: And most certainly shall We try you by means of danger, and hunger, and loss of worldly goods, of lives and of
Muhammad Asad.verse 2:215: who, when calamity befalls them, say, "Verily, unto God do we belong and, verily, unto Him we shall return.
Muhammad Asad.verse 2:216: It is they upon whom their Sustainer’s blessings and grace are bestowed, and it is they, they who are on the right path!
Muhammad Asad.verse 2:218: behold, As-Safā and Al-Marwah are among the symbols set up by God; and thus, no wrong does he who, having come to the Temple on pilgrimage or on a pious visit, strides to and fro between these two: for if one does more good than he is bound to do – behold, God is responsive to gratitude, all-knowing.
Muhammad Asad.verse 2:219: BEHOLD, as for those who suppress aught of the evidence of the truth and of the guidance which We have bestowed from on high, after We have made it clear unto mankind through the divine writ – these it is whom God will reject, and whom all who can judge will reject.
Muhammad Asad.verse 2:220: Excepted, however, shall be they that repent, and put themselves to rights, and make known the truth: and it is they whose repentance I shall accept – for I alone am the Acceptor of Repentance, the Dispenser of Grace.
Muhammad Asad.verse 2:221: Behold, as for those who are bent on denying the truth and die as deniers of the truth – their due is rejection by God, and by the angels, and by all
Muhammad Asad.verse 2:223: In this state shall they abide;
Muhammad Asad.verse 2:224: neither will their suffering be lightened, nor will they be granted respite.
Muhammad Asad.verse 2:225: AND YOUR GOD is the One God: there is no deity save Him, the Most Gracious, the Dispenser of Grace.
Muhammad Asad.verse 2:226: Verily, in the creation of the heavens and of the earth, and the succession of night and day: and in the ships that speed through the sea with what is useful to man: and in the waters which God sends down from the sky, giving life thereby to the earth after it had been lifeless, and causing all manner of living creatures to multiply thereon: and in the change of the winds, and the clouds that run their appointed courses between sky and earth: [in all this] there are messages indeed for people who use their reason.
Muhammad Asad.verse 2:227: And yet there are people who choose to believe in beings that allegedly rival God, loving them as
Muhammad Asad.verse 2:228: God should be loved: whereas those who have attained to faith love God more than all else.
Muhammad Asad.verse 2:229: [On that Day] it will come to pass that those who had been
Muhammad Asad.verse 2:230: adored shall disown their followers, and the latter shall see the suffering [that awaits them], with all their hopes cut to pieces!
Muhammad Asad.verse 2:231: And then those followers shall say: "Would that we had a second chance [in life], so that we could disown them as they have disowned us!" Thus will God show them their works [in a manner that will cause them] bitter regrets; but they will not come out of the fire.
Muhammad Asad.verse 2:232: O MANKIND! Partake of what is lawful and good on earth, and follow not Satan’s footsteps: for, verily, he is your open foe,
Muhammad Asad.verse 2:233: and bids you only to do evil, and to commit deeds of abomination, and to attribute unto God something of which you have no knowledge.
Muhammad Asad.verse 2:234: But when they are told, "Follow what God has bestowed from on high," some answer, "Nay, we shall follow
Muhammad Asad.verse 2:235: that which we found our forefathers believing in and doing.
Muhammad Asad.verse 2:236: And so, the parable of those who are bent on denying the truth is that of the beast which hears the shepherd’s cry, and hears in it nothing but the sound of a voice and a call.
Muhammad Asad.verse 2:237: O you who have attained to faith! Partake of the good things which We have provided for you as sustenance, and render thanks unto God, if it is
Muhammad Asad.verse 2:239: He has forbidden to you only carrion, and blood, and the flesh of swine, and that over which any name other than God’s has been invoked; but if one is driven by necessity – neither coveting it nor exceeding his immediate need – no sin shall be upon him: for, behold, God is much-forgiving, a dispenser of grace.
Muhammad Asad.verse 2:240: VERILY, as for those who suppress aught of the revelation which God has bestowed from on high, and barter it away for a trifling gain – they but fill their bellies with fire.
Muhammad Asad.verse 2:241: It is they who take error in exchange for guidance, and suffering in exchange for forgiveness: yet how little do they seem to fear the fire!
Muhammad Asad.verse 2:242: Thus it is: since it is God who bestows the divine writ from on high, setting forth the truth, all those who set their own views against the divine writ are, verily, most deeply in the wrong.
Muhammad Asad.verse 2:243: True piety does not consist in turning your faces towards the east or the west – but truly pious is he who believes in God, and the Last Day, and the angels, and revelation, and the prophets; and spends his substance – however much he himself may cherish it – upon his near of kin, and the orphans, and the needy, and the wayfarer, and the beggars, and for the freeing of human beings from bondage; and is constant in prayer, and renders the purifying dues; and [truly pious are] they who keep their promises whenever they promise, and are patient in misfortune and hardship and in time of peril: it is they that have proved themselves true, and it is they, they who are conscious of God.
Muhammad Asad.verse 2:244: O YOU who have attained to faith! Just retribution is ordained for you in cases of killing: the free for the free, and the slave for the slave, and the woman for the woman.
Muhammad Asad.verse 2:245: shall be adhered to with fairness, and restitution to his fellow-man shall be made in a goodly manner.
Muhammad Asad.verse 2:246: for, in [the law of] just retribution, O you who are endowed with insight, there is life for you, so that you might remain conscious of God!
Muhammad Asad.verse 2:247: IT IS ordained for you, when death approaches any of you and he is leaving behind much wealth, to make bequests in favour of his parents and
Muhammad Asad.verse 2:248: near of kin in accordance with what is fair: this is binding on all who are conscious of God.
Muhammad Asad.verse 2:249: And if anyone alters such a provision after having come to know it, the sin of acting thus shall fall only upon those who have altered it.
Muhammad Asad.verse 2:250: If, however, one has reason to fear that the testator has committed a mistake or a
Muhammad Asad.verse 2:251: wrong, and thereupon brings about a settlement between the heirs, he will incur no sin .
Muhammad Asad.verse 2:252: Verily, God is much-forgiving, a dispenser of grace.
Muhammad Asad.verse 2:253: O YOU who have attained to faith! Fasting is ordained for you as it was ordained for those before you, so that you might remain conscious of God:
Muhammad Asad.verse 2:255: during a certain number of days.
Muhammad Asad.verse 2:256: It was the month of Ramadān in which the Qur’ān was
Muhammad Asad.verse 2:257: bestowed from on high as a guidance unto man and a self-evident proof of that guidance, and as the standard by which to discern the true from the false.
Muhammad Asad.verse 2:258: AND IF My servants ask thee about Me – behold, I am near; I respond to the call of him who calls, whenever he calls unto Me: let them, then, respond unto Me, and believe in Me, so that they might follow the right way.
Muhammad Asad.verse 2:259: IT IS lawful for you to go in unto your wives during the night preceding the
Muhammad Asad.verse 2:260: fast: they are as a garment for you, and you are as a garment for them.
Muhammad Asad.verse 2:261: it is thus that God makes clear His messages unto mankind, so that they might remain conscious of Him.
Muhammad Asad.verse 2:262: AND DEVOUR NOT one another’s possessions wrongfully, and neither employ legal artifices with a view to devouring sinfully, and knowingly, anything that by right belongs to others.
Muhammad Asad.verse 2:263: THEY WILL ASK thee about the new moons.
Muhammad Asad.verse 2:264: AND FIGHT in God’s cause against those who wage war against you, but do not commit aggression – for, verily, God does not love aggressors.
Muhammad Asad.verse 2:265: And slay them wherever you may come upon them, and drive them away from wherever they drove you away – for oppression is even worse than killing.
Muhammad Asad.verse 2:266: But if they desist – behold, God is much-forgiving, a dispenser of grace.
Muhammad Asad.verse 2:267: Hence, fight against them until there is no more oppression and all worship is devoted to God alone; but if they desist, then all hostility shall cease, save against those who
Muhammad Asad.verse 2:269: Fight during the sacred months if you are attacked: for a violation of sanctity is [subject to the law of] just retribution.
Muhammad Asad.verse 2:271: in God’s cause, and let not your own hands throw you into destruction; and persevere in doing good: behold, God loves the doers of good.
Muhammad Asad.verse 2:272: AND PERFORM the pilgrimage and the pious visit [to Mecca] in honour of God; and if you are held back, give instead whatever offering you can easily afford.
Muhammad Asad.verse 2:273: All this relates to him who does not live near the Inviolable House of Worship.
Muhammad Asad.verse 2:274: The pilgrimage shall take place in the months appointed for it.
Muhammad Asad.verse 2:275: shall, while on pilgrimage, abstain from lewd speech, from all wicked conduct, and from quarrelling; and whatever good you may do, God is aware of it.
Muhammad Asad.verse 2:277: you will be committing no sin if [during the pilgrimage] you seek to obtain any bounty from your Sustainer.
Muhammad Asad.verse 2:278: and surge onward together with the multitude of all the other people who surge onward, and ask God to forgive you your sins: for, verily, God is much-forgiving, a dispenser of grace.
Muhammad Asad.verse 2:279: And when you have performed your acts of worship, [continue to] bear God in mind as you would bear your own fathers in mind – nay, with a yet keener remembrance! For there are people who
Muhammad Asad.verse 2:280: pray, "O our Sustainer! Give us in this world" – and such shall not partake in the blessings of the life to come.
Muhammad Asad.verse 2:281: But there are among them such as pray, "O our Sustainer! Grant us good in this world and good in the life to come, and keep us safe from suffering through the fire":
Muhammad Asad.verse 2:282: it is these that shall have their portion [of happiness] in return for what they have earned.
Muhammad Asad.verse 2:283: And bear God in mind during the appointed days; but he who hurries away within two days shall incur no sin, and he who tarries longer shall incur no sin, provided that he is conscious of God.
Muhammad Asad.verse 2:284: NOW THERE IS a kind of man whose views on the life of this world may please thee greatly, and [the more so as] he cites God as witness to what is in his heart and is, moreover, exceedingly skillful in argument.
Muhammad Asad.verse 2:285: But whenever he prevails, he goes about the earth spreading corruption and destroying
Muhammad Asad.verse 2:286: tilth and progeny: and God does not love corruption.
Muhammad Asad.verse 2:287: And whenever he is told, "Be conscious of God," his false pride drives him into sin: wherefore hell will be his allotted portion – and how vile a resting-place!
Muhammad Asad.verse 2:289: a kind of man who would willingly sell his own self in order to please God: and God is most compassionate towards His servants.
Muhammad Asad.verse 2:290: O you who have attained to faith! Surrender yourselves wholly unto God, and follow not Satan’s footsteps, for, verily, he is your open foe.
Muhammad Asad.verse 2:291: And if you should stumble after all evidence of the truth has come unto you, then know that, verily, God is almighty, wise.
Muhammad Asad.verse 2:292: Are these people waiting, perchance, for God to reveal Himself unto them in the shadows of the clouds, together with the angels – although [by then] all will have been decided, and unto God all things will have been brought back?
Muhammad Asad.verse 2:293: Ask the children of Israel how many a clear message We have given them! And if one alters God’s blessed message after it has reached him – verily, God is severe in retribution!
Muhammad Asad.verse 2:294: Unto those who are bent on denying the truth the life of this world
Muhammad Asad.verse 2:295: seems goodly; hence, they scoff at those who have attained to faith: but they who are conscious of God shall be above them on Resurrection Day.
Muhammad Asad.verse 2:296: ALL MANKIND were once one single community; [then they began to differ –] whereupon God raised up the prophets as heralds of glad tidings and as warners, and through them bestowed revelation from on high, setting forth the truth, so that it might decide between people with regard to all on which they had come to hold divergent views.

Muhammad Asad.verse 2:304: FIGHTING is ordained for you, even though it be hateful to you; but it may well be that you hate a thing the while it is good for you, and it may well be that you love a thing the while it is bad for you: and God knows, whereas you do not know.
Muhammad Asad.verse 2:305: They will ask thee about fighting in the sacred month.
Muhammad Asad.verse 2:306: Verily, they who have attained to faith, and they who have forsaken the domain of evil and are striving hard in God’s cause – these it is who may look forward to God’s grace: for God is much-forgiving, a dispenser of grace.

Muhammad Asad.verse 2:315: Your wives are your tilth; go, then, unto your tilth as you may desire, but first provide something for your souls, and remain conscious of God, and know that you are destined to meet Him.
Muhammad Asad.verse 2:316: AND DO NOT allow your oaths in the name of God to become an obstacle to virtue and God-consciousness and the promotion of peace between men: for God is all-hearing, all-knowing.
Muhammad Asad.verse 2:317: God will not take you to task for oaths which you may have uttered without thought, but will take you to task
Muhammad Asad.verse 2:318: for what your hearts have conceived [in earnest]: for God is much-forgiving, forbearing.
Muhammad Asad.verse 2:319: Those who take an oath that they will not approach their wives shall have four months of grace; and if they go back [on their oath] – behold, God is much-forgiving, a dispenser of grace.
Muhammad Asad.verse 2:320: But if they are resolved on divorce – behold, God is all-hearing, all-knowing.
Muhammad Asad.verse 2:321: And the divorced women shall undergo, without remarrying, a waiting-period of three monthly courses: for it is not lawful for them to conceal what God may have created in their wombs, if they believe in God and the Last Day.

Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 2:35: And We said, “O ’Ādam, dwell, you and your wife, in Paradise; and eat at pleasure wherever you like, but do not go near this tree, otherwise you will be (counted) among the transgressors.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 2:36: Then, Satan caused them to slip from it, and brought them out of where they had been.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 2:37: Then ’Ādam learned certain words (to pray with) from his Lord; so, Allah accepted his repentance.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 2:38: We said, “Go down from here, all of you.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 2:39: As for those who disbelieve, and deny Our signs, they are the people of the Fire.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 2:40: O Children of Isrā’īl (the Israelites), remember My blessing that I conferred upon you, and fulfill the covenant with Me, and I shall fulfill your covenant, and have awe of Me alone.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 2:41: And have faith in what I have revealed, confirming what is already with you, and do not be the first to deny it, nor take a paltry price for My verses.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 2:42: and do not confound truth with falsehood, and do not hide the truth when you know (it).
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 2:43: And be steadfast in Salāh (prayer), and pay Zakāh, and bow down with those who bow down.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 2:44: Do you enjoin righteousness upon others while you ignore your own selves, although you keep reciting the Book? Have you then no sense?
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 2:45: Seek help through patience and prayer.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 2:46: who bear in mind that they are to meet their Lord, and that to Him they are to return.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 2:47: O Children of Isrā’īl (Israel), remember My blessing that I conferred upon you, and that I gave you excellence over the worlds;
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 2:48: and guard yourselves against a day when no one shall stand for anyone in anything, nor shall intercession be accepted on anyone’s behalf, nor shall ransom be taken from him, and neither shall any be given support.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 2:49: (Remember) when We delivered you from the people of Pharaoh! They had been inflicting on you grievous torment, slaughtering your sons and leaving your women alive.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 2:50: And (recall) when We parted the sea for you; then We saved you, and drowned the people of Pharaoh while you were looking on!
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 2:51: And when We appointed forty nights for Mūsā, then you took the calf (as God) thereafter, and you were unjust.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 2:52: Yet We pardoned you, even after that, so that you may show gratitude.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 2:53: Then We gave Mūsā the Book and the Criterion (of right and wrong), so that you may find the right path.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 2:54: When Mūsā said to his people: “My people, you have wronged yourselves by your taking the calf (as God).
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 2:55: When you said, “Mūsā, we will never believe you till we see Allah openly!” So, the thunderbolt took you while you were looking on.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 2:56: Then, We raised you up after your death, so that you might show gratitude.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 2:57: And We made the cloud give you shade, and sent down to you Mann and Salwā: “Eat of the good things We have provided to you”.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 2:58: When We said, “Enter this town, and eat to your heart’s content wherever you wish in it; and enter the gate prostrating yourselves and say: HiTTah (we seek forgiveness), so that We forgive your errors.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 2:59: But those who were unjust substituted another word for the one that was prescribed for them.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 2:60: When Mūsā sought water for his people, We said, “Strike the rock with your staff,” And twelve springs gushed forth from it.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 2:61: And when you said, “Mūsā , we will no longer confine ourselves to a single food: So, pray for us to your Lord that He may bring forth for us of what the earth grows - of its vegetable, its cucumbers, its wheat, its lentils and its onions.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 2:62: Surely, those who believed in Allah, and those who are Jews, and Christians, and Sabians, -whosoever believes in Allah and in the Last Day, and does good deeds - all such people will have their reward with their Lord, and there will be no reason for them to fear, nor shall they grieve.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 2:63: And when We took the pledge from you, and raised high above you the (Mount of) Tūr: “Hold fast to what We have given to you, and remember what is in it, so that you may become God-fearing.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 2:64: Then even after that, you turned away.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 2:65: Certainly you have knowledge of those among you who transgressed in (the matter of) the Sabbath.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 2:66: Thus, We made it a deterrent for those around and (those who came) after them - and a lesson for the God-fearing.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 2:67: When Mūsā said to his people, “Allah commands you to slaughter a cow”, they said, “Are you making fun of us?” He said, “I seek refuge with Allah from being one of the ignorant.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 2:68: They said, “Pray for us to your Lord that He makes it clear to us what sort (of cow) should she be.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 2:69: They said, “Pray for us to your Lord that He makes it clear to us of what colour it should be.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 2:70: They said, “Pray for us to your Lord that He makes it clear to us of what sort should she be, for this cow has made us confused and, if Allah wills, We shall certainly take the right course.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 2:71: He said, “He says that it should be a cow which is not tractable for tilling the soil or in watering the fields, (and it should be) sound and without blemish.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 2:72: And when you killed a man, and started putting the blame for it on one another, while Allah was to bring forth what you were holding back.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 2:73: So, We said, “Strike him with a part of it.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 2:74: When, even after that, your hearts were hardened, as if they were rocks, or still worse in hardness.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 2:75: (O Muslims) do you still fancy that they will believe you, although a group of them used to hear the word of Allah, and then, having understood it, used to distort it knowingly?
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 2:76: When they meet those who believe, they say, “We believe.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 2:77: Are they not aware that Allah knows what they conceal and what they reveal?
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 2:78: And some among them are illiterate who have no knowledge of the Book, but have some fancies and do nothing but conjecture.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 2:79: So, woe to those who write the Book with their hands and then say, “This is from Allah”, so that they may gain thereby a trifling price.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 2:80: They say, “The fire shall not touch us for more than a few days.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 2:81: Why not? Those who commit evil and are besieged by their sins, those are people of the Fire - there they shall live forever.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 2:82: As for those who believe, and do good deeds, they are the people of Paradise - there they will live forever.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 2:83: (Remember) when We took a pledge from the children of Isrā’īl (Israel): “You shall not worship anyone other than Allah; and you shall do good to the parents, and to near of kin, and to orphans and the needy.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 2:84: When We took a pledge from you: “You shall not shed the blood of one another, and you shall not drive one another out of your homes.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 2:85: Yet, here you are, killing one another, and driving a group of your own people out of their homes, supporting each other against them in sin and aggression - and if they come to you as prisoners, you would ransom them, while their very expulsion was unlawful for you! Do you, then, believe in some parts of the Book, and disbelieve in others? So, what can be the punishment of those among you who do that, except disgrace in present life? And, on the Day of Judgement, they shall be turned to the most severe punishment.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 2:86: Those are the ones who bought the worldly life at the cost of the Hereafter.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 2:87: Indeed, We gave Mūsā the Book, and after him We sent messengers, one following the other; and We gave clear signs to ‘Īsā, the son of Maryam (Jesus, the son of Mary), and supported him with the Holy Spirit.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 2:88: And they said, “Our hearts are veiled.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 2:89: And when there came to them a Book from Allah, which confirms what was with them,- while earlier, they used to seek help against those who disbelieved, - yet when there came to them that which they did recognize, they denied it.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 2:90: Vile is that for which they have sold out their selves: that they should deny what Allah has revealed, grudging that Allah should send down some of His bounty to whomsoever He wills from among His servants.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 2:91: When it is said to them, “Believe in what Allah has revealed,” they say, “We believe in what has been revealed to us” - and they deny what is beyond it, whereas that is the truth which confirms what is with them.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 2:92: And certainly Mūsā came to you with clear signs, then you adopted the calf (as god) after his departure (to the mount of Tūr) - and you were transgressors.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 2:93: And when We took a pledge from you, and raised high the (mount of) Tūr above you: “Hold fast to what We have given you, and listen”! They said, “We have heard and disobeyed.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 2:94: Say: “If the Last Abode near Allah is purely for you, to the exclusion of all people, then make a wish for death, if you are true.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 2:95: But they will never wish for it because of what their hands have sent ahead.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 2:96: You shall surely find them the more avid, for life than all other men - even more than the polytheists.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 2:97: Say, if someone is an enemy to Jibra’īl (Gabriel) (it can by no means degrade him for) it is he who has brought it (the Qur’ān) down upon your heart by the permission of Allah, confirming what has been before it, and a guidance and good tidings to the believers.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 2:98: If someone is an enemy to Allah, His angels, and His messengers, and to Jibra’īl (Gabriel) and Mīka’īl (Michael), then Allah is enemy to the disbelievers.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 2:99: And certainly We have revealed to you clear signs.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 2:100: Would it always be that every time they enter into a pact, a group from among them should throw it aside? In fact, most of them do not believe.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 2:101: And when a messenger from Allah came to them, confirming what was already with them, some from among the people of the Book threw the Book of Allah behind their backs, as if they did not know.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 2:102: They followed what the devils used to recite in the reign of Sulaimān (Solomon); and it was not Sulaimān who became an infidel, but the devils did become infidels, teaching people magic, and what had been sent down to the two angels, Hārūt and Mārūt, in Babylon.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 2:103: And had they accepted the faith, and been God-fearing, the reward from Allah would have always been far better.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 2:104: O you who believe, do not say Rā‘inā, but say UnZurnā, and listen, as there is a grievous punishment for the unbelievers.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 2:105: Those who disbelieve from among the people of the Book and the idolaters do not like that any good should come to you from your Lord.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 2:106: Whenever We abrogate a verse or cause it to be forgotten, We bring one better than it or one equal to it.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 2:107: Do you not know that to Allah alone belongs the kingdom of the heavens and the earth? Other than Allah, you have neither a patron, nor a helper.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 2:108: Or, do you rather want to question your Prophet as Mūsā was questioned earlier? And whoever takes infidelity in exchange for faith has certainly missed the straight path.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 2:109: (O Muslims,) many among the people of the Book desire to turn you, after your accepting the faith, back into disbelievers - all out of envy on their part, even after the truth has become clear to them.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 2:110: And be steadfast in Salāh (prayer), and give Zakāh.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 2:111: They say that no one shall ever enter Paradise unless he is a Jew, or a Christian.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 2:112: Of course, whosoever submits his face to Allah, and is good in deeds, will have his reward with his Lord, and there shall be no fear for such people, nor shall they grieve.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 2:113: The Jews say: “The Christians have nothing to stand on” and the Christians say “The Jews have nothing to stand on” while they both read the Book! Similarly, those who do not know have said like they (the Jews and the Christians) say.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 2:114: Who is more cruel than the one who prevents the mosques of Allah from His name being recited therein, and strives for their destruction? It was not for such men to enter them except in awe.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 2:115: To Allah belongs the East and the West.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 2:116: They say: “Allah has got a son.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 2:117: (He is the) Originator of the heavens and the earth.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 2:118: Those who do not know say: “Why is it that Allah does not speak to us, nor does a sign come to us?” So spoke those before them as these people do.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 2:119: Surely, We have sent you with the truth, as a bearer of good tidings, and a warner, and you will not be asked about the people of Hell.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 2:120: The Jews will never be pleased with you, nor will the Christians, unless you follow their faith.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 2:121: Those to whom We have given the Book and they recite it observing the rights of its recitation - they are the ones who believe in it.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 2:122: O children of Isrā’īl (Israel), remember My blessing that I conferred upon you, and that I gave you excellence over the worlds.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 2:123: And guard yourselves against a day when no one shall stand for anyone for anything, nor shall ransom be accepted from anyone, nor shall intercession be of benefit to him, nor shall any support be given to such people.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 2:124: When his Lord put Ibrāhīm to a test with certain Words, and he fulfilled them, He said, “I am going to make you an Imām for the people.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 2:125: When We made the House (Ka‘bah of Makkah) a frequented place for men, and a place of peace! Make from the Station of Ibrāhīm a place of prayer.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 2:126: (Recall) when Ibrāhīm said, “My Lord, make this a city of peace, and provide its people with fruits - those of them who believe in Allah and the Last Day.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 2:127: When Ibrāhīm was raising up the foundations of the House, along with Ismā‘īl (Ishmael) (supplicating): “Our Lord accept (this service) from us! Indeed, You - and You alone - are the All-Hearing, the All-Knowing!
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 2:128: Our Lord, make us both submissive to You, and (make) of our progeny as well, a people submissive to You and show us our ways of Pilgrimage and accept our repentance.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 2:129: And, our Lord, raise in their midst a Messenger from among them, who should recite to them Your verses, and teach them the Book and the wisdom, and cleanse them of all impurities.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 2:130: Who can turn away from the faith of Ibrāhīm except the one who has debased himself in folly? Indeed We have chosen him in this world.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 2:131: When his Lord said to him, “Submit!” He said, “I submit myself to the Lord of all the worlds.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 2:132: And Ibrāhīm exhorted the same to his sons, and so did Ya‘qūb (Jacob): “My sons, Allah has certainly chosen for you the Faith.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 2:133: Is it that you were present when death approached Ya‘qūb, when he said to his sons: “What will you worship after me”? They said, “We will worship your God and the God of your fathers, Ibrāhīm, Ismā‘īl (Ishmael) and IsHāq (Isaac), the one God, and to Him we submit ourselves.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 2:134: Those are a people who have passed away.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 2:135: They said, “Become Jews or Christians, and you will find the right path.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 2:136: Say (O, Muslims): “We believe in Allah, and in what has been revealed to us, and in what has been revealed to Ibrāhīm, Ismā‘īl (Ishmael), IsHāq (Isaac), Ya‘qūb and his children, and in what has been given to Mūsā and ‘Īsā (Jesus) and what has been given to the prophets from their Lord: We make no difference between any of them, and to Him we submit ourselves.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 2:137: So, if they believe in the same way as you believe, they will have certainly found the right path, and if they turn away, then the fact is that they are in antagonism.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 2:138: (We dye ourselves with) the colouring of Allah! For who is better in colouring than Allah? We are to worship none but Him.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 2:139: Say: “Would you argue with us about Allah, when He is our Lord as well as your Lord? For us our deeds, and for you your deeds! And we are faithful to Him.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 2:140: Or, would you say that Ibrāhīm, Ismā‘īl, IsHāq, Ya‘qūb and their children were Jews or Christians?” Say: “Do you know better or does Allah?” Who can be more unjust than the one who conceals the testimony he has from Allah? Allah is not unaware of what you do.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 2:141: Those are a people who have passed away.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 2:142: The foolish among the people will say: “What has turned them away from their Qiblah which they used to observe?” Say: “To Allah belong the East and the West.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 2:143: In the same way We made you a moderate Ummah (community), so that you should be witnesses over the people, and the Messenger a witness to you.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 2:144: We have been seeing you turning your face to the heavens.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 2:145: Even if you bring every sign to those who have been given the Book, they would not follow your Qiblah, and you are not to follow their Qiblah, nor are they to follow each other’s Qiblah.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 2:146: Those whom We have given the Book recognize him (the Holy Prophet) as they recognize their own sons.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 2:147: The truth is from your Lord.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 2:148: For everyone there is a direction to which he turns his face.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 2:149: From wherever you set out, turn your face in the direction of the Sacred Mosque (Al-Masjid-ul-Harām).
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 2:150: And from wherever you set out, turn your face in the direction of the Sacred Mosque (Al-Masjid-ul-Harām), and (O Muslims), wherever you are, turn your faces in its direction, so that people should have no argument against you, except for those among them who are unjust,- do not fear them, but fear Me-, and so that I should perfect My blessings upon you, and that you may take the right path.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 2:151: As also We have sent in your midst a messenger from among you, who recites to you Our verses, and purifies you, and teaches you the Book and the wisdom, and teaches you what you did not know.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 2:152: So Remember Me, and I will remember you, and be thankful to Me, and be not ungrateful to Me.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 2:153: O you who believe, seek help through patience and prayer.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 2:154: Do not say of those who are slain in the way of Allah that they are dead.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 2:155: Surely We will test you with a bit of fear and hunger, and loss in wealth and lives and fruits, and give good tidings to the patient.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 2:156: who, when a suffering visits them, say: “We certainly belong to Allah, and to Him we are bound to return.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 2:157: Those are the ones upon whom there are blessings from their Lord, and mercy as well; and those are the ones who are on the right path.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 2:158: Indeed Safā and Marwah are among the marks of Allah.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 2:159: Surely, those who conceal the clear signs and the guidance We have revealed, even after We have explained them for people in the Book, upon them Allah casts damnation, and they are cursed by all those who curse.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 2:160: Yet, those who repent and correct and declare (what they used to conceal), their repentance is accepted by Me.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 2:161: Indeed, those who disbelieved and died while they were disbelievers, upon them is the curse of Allah, and of angels, and of all human beings together,
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 2:162: in a way that they will remain in it forever.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 2:163: Your god is one God: There is no god but He, the All-Merciful, the Very-Merciful.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 2:164: Surely, in the creation of heavens and earth, and the alternation of night and day, and the ships that sail in the sea, carrying that which benefits men, and in the water Allah sent down from the sky, then revived with it the earth after it was dead, and in every creature He has scattered on it, and in turning of winds, and in the clouds employed to serve between heaven and earth, there are signs for those who have sense.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 2:165: Among the people there are some who set up co-gods beside Allah whom they love like the love due to Allah.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 2:166: (Imagine the time) when those who were followed will disown their followers, and they (all) will see the punishment, and the bonds between them will be cut asunder,
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 2:167: and those who followed will say, “We wish we had another (chance to) return (to the world), so that we may disown them as they had disowned us.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 2:168: O people, eat permissible good things out of what lies in the earth, and do not follow the footsteps of ShaiTān (Satan); indeed, he is an open enemy for you.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 2:169: He orders you only to (do) evil and immodest acts, and that you ascribe to Allah what you do not know.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 2:170: When it is said to them: “Follow what Allah has sent down,” they say: “Instead, we would follow that (religion) on which we have found our fathers.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 2:171: The example of (calling) those who disbelieve is such as someone is shouting at an animal that hears nothing but a call and cry.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 2:172: O you who believe, eat of the good things We have provided to you and be grateful to Allah, if it is He whom you worship (in real terms).
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 2:173: He has only prohibited for you carrion, blood, the flesh of swine and that upon which a name of someone other than ‘Allah’ has been invoked.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 2:174: Verily, those who conceal the Book Allah has revealed, and earn thereby a small price, they eat nothing into their bellies but fire, and Allah will not speak to them on the Day of Judgment, nor will He purify them, and for them there is painful punishment.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 2:175: They are those who have bought the wrong way at the price of the right way, and punishment at the price of pardon.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 2:176: All that is because Allah revealed the Book with the truth.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 2:177: Righteousness is not (merely) that you turn your faces to the East and the West; but righteousness is that one believes in Allah and the Last Day and the angels and the Book and the Prophets, and gives wealth, despite (his) love for it, to relatives, and to orphans, the helpless, the wayfarer, and to those who ask, and (spends) in (freeing) slaves and observes the Salāh (prayers) and pays Zakah-and (the act of) those who fulfill their covenant when they enter into a covenant, and, of course, those who are patient in hardship and suffering and when in battle! Those are the ones who are truthful, and those are the God - fearing.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 2:178: O you who believe, QiSāS has been prescribed for you in the case of murdered people: The freeman (will be killed) for the freeman, the slave for the slave, and the female for the female.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 2:179: There is life for you in QiSāS, O people of wisdom, so that you may refrain (from killing).
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 2:180: It is enjoined upon you, when death approaches any one of you and he leaves some wealth, that he must bequeath for the parents and the nearest of kin in the approved manner, being an obligation on the God-fearing.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 2:181: Then, whoever changes it after he has heard it, its sin will only be on those who change it.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 2:182: But, whoever apprehends a mistake (unintentional) or a sin (intentional) from a testator, and puts things right between them, then there is no sin on him.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 2:183: O you who believe, the fasts have been enjoined upon you as they were enjoined upon those before you, so that you may be God-fearing,
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 2:185: The month of Ramadan is the one in which the Qur’ān was revealed as guidance for mankind, and as clear signs that show the right way and distinguish between right and wrong.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 2:186: When My servants ask you about Me, then (tell them that) I am near.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 2:187: It is made lawful for you, in the nights of fasts, to have sex with your women.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 2:188: Do not eat up each other’s property by false means, nor approach with it the authorities to eat up a portion of the property of the people sinfully, while you know (that you are unjust in doing so).
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 2:189: They ask you about the new moons.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 2:190: Fight in the way of Allah against those who fight you, and do not transgress.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 2:191: Kill them wherever you find them, and drive them out from where they drove you out, as Fitnah (to create disorder) is more severe than killing.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 2:192: But if they desist, then indeed, Allah is Most-Forgiving, Very- Merciful.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 2:193: Fight them until there is no Fitnah any more, and obedience remains for Allah.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 2:194: The holy month for the holy month, and the sanctities are subject to retribution.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 2:195: Spend in the way of Allah and do not put yourselves into destruction, and do good.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 2:196: Accomplish the Hajj and the ‘Umrah for Allah, but if you are restricted, then (sacrifice) whatever animal of offering is available, and do not shave your heads until the offering reaches its place.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 2:197: The Hajj is (to be performed in) the months that are well-known.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 2:198: There is no sin on you that you seek the grace of your Lord (by trading).
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 2:199: Then flow down from where the people flow, and seek forgiveness from Allah.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 2:200: Once you have fulfilled your modes of worship in Hajj, recite the name of Allah, as you would speak of your forefathers or even with greater fervor.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 2:201: Yet there is another among them who says: “Our Lord, give us good in this world and good in the Hereafter, and save us from the punishment of Fire.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 2:202: For them there is a share of what they have earned; and Allah is swift at reckoning.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 2:203: Recite the name of Allah during the given number of days.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 2:204: Among men there is one whose speech, in this life, attracts you; he even makes Allah his witness on what is in his heart, while he is extremely quarrelsome.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 2:205: Once he turns back, he moves about in the land trying to spread disorder in it, and to destroy the tillage and the stock; and Allah does not like disorder.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 2:206: When it is said to him, “Fear Allah”, he is tempted by arrogance to (commit) sin.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 2:207: And among men there is one who sells his very soul to seek the pleasure of Allah, and Allah is Very-Kind to His servants.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 2:208: O you who believe, enter Islam completely, and do not follow the footsteps of Satan.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 2:209: and if you slip, even after clear signs have come to you, then you must know that Allah is Mighty, Wise.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 2:210: They are looking for nothing (to accept the truth) but that Allah (Himself) comes upon them in canopies of cloud with angels, and the matter is closed.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 2:211: Ask the Children of Isrā’īl (Israel) how many a clear sign We have given to them; and whoever changes the blessing of Allah after it has come to him, then Allah is severe in punishment.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 2:212: Adorned is the present life for those who disbelieve, and they laugh at those who believe, while those who fear Allah shall be above them on the Day of Resurrection.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 2:213: All men used to be a single ’Ummah (i.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 2:214: Do you think that you will enter Paradise while you have not yet been visited by (difficult) circumstances like those that were faced by the people who passed away before you? They were afflicted by hardship and suffering, and were so shaken down that the prophet, and those who believed with him, started saying: “When (will come) the help of Allah?” (Then, they were comforted by the Prophet who said to them) ‘Behold, the help of Allah is near.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 2:215: They ask you as to what they should spend.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 2:216: Fighting is enjoined upon you, while it is hard on you.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 2:217: They ask you about the Sacred Month, that is, about fighting in it.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 2:218: As for those who believed and those who migrated and carried out Jihād in the way of Allah, they hope for Allah’s mercy: and Allah is Forgiving, Very-Merciful.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 2:219: They ask you about wine and gambling.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 2:220: on this world and the Hereafter.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 2:221: Do not marry the polytheist women, unless they come to believe (in Islam); a Muslim slave-girl is better than a polytheist woman, even though she may attract you; and do not give (your women) in marriage to polytheist men, unless they come to believe; a Muslim slave is better than a polytheist, even though he may attract you.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 2:223: Your women are tillage for you to cultivate.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 2:224: Do not make (the name of) Allah the subject of your oaths against your doing good, fearing Allah and setting things right between people.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 2:225: Allah does not hold you accountable for what is laghw (ineffectual) in your oaths, but He holds you accountable for what your hearts have produced.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 2:226: Those who swear to abstain from their wives have four months of waiting.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 2:227: and if they resolve to divorce, Allah is All-Hearing, All-Knowing.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 2:228: Divorced women shall keep themselves waiting for three periods, and it is not permissible for them to conceal what Allah has created in their wombs, if they believe in Allah and in the Last Day.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 2:229: Divorce is twice; then either to retain in all fairness, or to release nicely.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 2:230: Thereafter, if he divorces her, she shall no longer remain lawful for him unless she marries a man other than him.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 2:231: When you have divorced women, and they have approached (the end of) their waiting periods, then, either retain them with fairness or release them with fairness.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 2:232: When you have divorced women, and they have reached (the end of) their waiting period, do not prevent them from marrying their husbands when they mutually agree with fairness.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 2:233: Mothers (should) suckle their children for two full years, for one who wants to complete the (period of) suckling.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 2:234: Those among you who pass away and leave wives behind, their wives keep themselves waiting for four months and ten days.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 2:235: There is no sin on you if you hint as a proposal to the women, or conceal it in your hearts.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 2:236: There is no liability (of dower) on you if you divorce women when you have not yet touched them, nor fixed for them an amount.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 2:237: If you divorce them before you have touched them, while you have already fixed for them an amount (of dower), then there is one half of what you have fixed, unless they (the women) forgive, or forgives the one in whose hand lies the marriage tie, and it is closer to Taqwā (righteousness) that you forgive, and do not forget to be graceful to one another.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 2:238: Take due care of all the prayers, and the middle prayer, and stand before Allah in total devotion.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 2:239: But if you are in fear, then (pray) on foot or riding.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 2:240: Those among you who pass away and leave wives behind are (commanded) to make a will in favour of their wives to be maintained for one year without being expelled (from husband’s home).
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 2:241: The divorced women deserve a benefit according to the fair practice, being an obligation on the God-fearing.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 2:242: This is how Allah makes His verses clear to you, so that you may understand.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 2:243: Have you not seen those who left their homes, while they were in thousands, to escape death? So, Allah said to them, “Be dead.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 2:244: Fight in the way of Allah, and know that Allah is All-Hearing, All-Knowing.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 2:245: Who is the one who would give Allah a good loan so that Allah multiplies it for him many times? Allah withholds and extends, and to Him you are to be returned.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 2:246: Did you not see a group from the children of Isrā’īl (Israel), after (the time of) Mūsā when they said to their prophet: “Appoint for us a king, so that we may fight in the way of Allah.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 2:247: Their prophet said to them: “Allah has appointed Tālūt as a king for you.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 2:248: Their prophet said to them: “The sign of his kingship is that the Ark shall come to you, carried by the angels, having therein tranquillity from your Lord, and the remains of what the House of Mūsā and the House of Hārūn (Aaron) had left.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 2:249: So, when Tālūt set out along with the troops, he said: “Allah is going to test you by a river, so, whoever drinks from it is not my man, and whoever does not taste it is surely a man of mine, except the one who scoops a little with his hand.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 2:250: And when they faced Jālūt and his troops, they said: “Our Lord, pour out endurance on us, make firm our feet and help us against the disbelieving people.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 2:251: So, they defeated them by the will of Allah, and Dāwūd (David) killed Jālūt, and Allah gave him the kingdom and the wisdom and taught him what He willed.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 2:252: These are the verses of Allah that We recite to you (O Prophet), with all veracity, and certainly you are among the Messengers.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 2:253: Those are the messengers some of whom We have given excellence over some others.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 2:254: O you who believe! Spend from what We have given to you before a day comes when there will be no trading, no friendship and no intercession, and it is the disbelievers who are unjust.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 2:255: Allah: There is no god but He, the Living, the All-Sustaining.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 2:256: There is no compulsion in Faith.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 2:257: Allah is the Protector of those who believe.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 2:258: Do you not know the one who argued with Ibrāhīm about his Lord, because Allah had given him kingship? When Ibrāhīm said: “My Lord is the One Who gives life and brings death,” he said: “I give life and I bring death.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 2:259: Or, (do you not know) the example of the one who passed through a town that had collapsed on its roofs.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 2:260: (Remember) when Ibrāhīm said: “My Lord, show me how You give life to the dead.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 2:261: The example of those who spend in the way of Allah is just like a grain that produced seven ears, each ear having a hundred grains, and Allah multiplies (the reward) for whom He wills.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 2:262: Those who spend their wealth in the way of Allah, then do not make their spending followed by boasting about favour, or with causing hurt,- they have their reward with their Lord and there is no fear for them nor shall they grieve.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 2:263: A graceful word and forgiving is better than charity followed by causing hurt.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 2:264: O you who believe, do not nullify your acts of charity by boasting about (doing people a) favour and by causing (them) hurt, like the one who spends his wealth to show off before peopleand does not believe in Allah and in the Last Day.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 2:265: The example of those who spend their wealth to seek the pleasure of Allah and to make firm (their faith) from (the depths of) their souls is like a garden on a foothill on which came a heavy rain, and it yielded its produce twofold.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 2:266: Would any of you wish to have a garden of dates and grapes, with rivers flowing beneath it, in which there are all kinds of fruit for him, and old age befalls him, and he has children who are (too) weak (to earn livelihood), then a whirlwind comes upon it with fire in it, and it is all burnt? This is how Allah makes the signs clear to you, so that you may ponder.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 2:267: O you who believe, spend of the good things you have earned, and of what We have brought forth for you from the earth, and do not opt for a bad thing, spending only from it, while you are not going to accept it (if such a thing is offered to you), unless you close your eyes to it, and know well that Allah is All-Independent, Ever-Praised.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 2:268: Satan frightens you with poverty, and bids you to commit indecency, and Allah promises you forgiveness from Him, and grace as well.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 2:269: He gives wisdom to whom He wills, and whoever is given wisdom is certainly given a lot of good.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 2:270: Whatever expenditure you spend and whatever vow you make, Allah knows all of it, and for the unjust, there are no supporters.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 2:271: If you make Sadaqāt (alms) openly, it is good enough, and if you keep it secret and give it to the needy, it is much better for you, and this will write off part of your sins.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 2:272: It is not for you to put them on the right path.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 2:273: (Your charities should be preferably meant) for the needy who are confined in the way of Allah, unable to travel in the land.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 2:274: Those who spend their wealth night and day, secretly and openly,- they have their reward with their Lord, and there is no fear for them, nor shall they grieve.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 2:275: Those who take ribā (usury or interest) will not stand but as stands the one whom the demon has driven crazy by his touch.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 2:276: Allah destroys ribā and nourishes charities, and Allah does not like any sinful disbeliever.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 2:277: Surely those who believe and do good deeds, and establish Salāh (prayer) and pay Zakāh will have their reward with their Lord, and there is no fear for them, nor shall they grieve.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 2:278: O you who believe, fear Allah and give up what still remains of ribā, if you are believers.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 2:279: But if you do not (give it up), then listen to the declaration of war from Allah and His Messenger.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 2:280: If there is one in misery, then (the creditor should allow) deferment till (his) ease, and that you forgo it as alms is much better for you, if you really know.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 2:281: Be fearful of a day when you shall be returned to Allah, then every person shall be paid, in full, what he has earned, and they shall not be wronged.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 2:282: O you who believe, when you transact a debt payable at a specified time, put it in writing, and let a scribe write it between you with fairness.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 2:283: If you are on a journey, and find no scribe, then (you may have resort to holding something as) mortgage, taken into possession.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 2:284: To Allah belongs what is in the heavens and what is in the earth.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 2:285: The Messenger has believed in what has been revealed to him from his Lord, and the believers as well.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 2:286: Allah does not obligate anyone beyond his capacity.

Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 2:2: That Book, in it there is no doubt.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 2:3: who believe in the Unseen, and maintain the prayer; and of what We have provided them expend;
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 2:4: and who believe in what has been revealed to you; and what was revealed before you; and of the Hereafter, they are certain.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 2:5: Those are upon guidance from their Lord; those are the ones that will prosper.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 2:6: As for the disbelievers, alike it is for them whether you have warned them or have not warned them, they do not believe.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 2:7: God has set a seal on their hearts, and on their hearing; and on their eyes is a covering; and for them there will be a mighty chastisement.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 2:8: And some people there are who say, 'We believe in God and the Last Day'; but they are not believers.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 2:9: They would deceive God and the believers; and only themselves they deceive; and they are not aware.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 2:10: In their hearts is a sickness; and God has increased their sickness; and there awaits them a painful chastisement because they used to lie.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 2:11: When it is said to them, 'Do not corruption in the land', they say, 'We are only putting things right'.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 2:12: Truly, they are the agents of corruption, but they perceive not.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 2:13: When it is said to them, ‘Believe as the people believe’, they say, ‘Shall we believe as fools believe?’ Truly, they are the foolish ones, but they know not.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 2:14: When they meet those who believe, they say, 'We believe'; but when they go apart to their devils they say, 'We are with you; we were only mocking'.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 2:16: mocks them, leaving them in their insolence, bewildered.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 2:17: Those are they who have bought error for guidance; so their commerce has not profited them; nor are they guided.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 2:18: Their likeness is as the likeness of one who kindled a fire, and when it illumined all about him God took away their light and left them in darkness, unable to see,
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 2:19: deaf, dumb, blind, they shall not return.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 2:20: Or as a cloudburst out of the heaven in which is darkness, and thunder, and lightning - they put their fingers in their ears against the thunderclaps, cautious of death; and God encompasses the disbelievers.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 2:21: The lightning well-nigh snatches away their sight; whensoever it gives them light, they walk in it; and when the darkness is over them, they stop; had God willed, He would have taken away their hearing and their sight; Truly, God has power over all things.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 2:22: O people, worship your Lord Who created you and those that were before you, so that you may be fearful.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 2:23: He Who assigned to you the earth for a couch and heaven for an edifice; and sent down from the heaven water, wherewith He brought forth fruits for your provision; so set not up compeers to God, while you know.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 2:24: And if you are in doubt concerning what We have revealed to Our servant, then bring a sūra like it; and call your witnesses besides God if you are truthful.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 2:25: And if you do not and you will not, then fear the Fire, whose fuel is men, and stones, prepared for disbelievers.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 2:26: And give good tidings to those who believe and perform righteous deeds that theirs shall be Gardens underneath which rivers run; whensoever they are provided with fruits therefrom, they shall say, 'This is what we were provided with before'; they shall be given it in perfect semblance; and there for them shall be spouses purified; therein they shall abide.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 2:27: God is not ashamed to strike a similitude even of a gnat, or anything above it; as for the believers, they know it is the truth from their Lord; but as for disbelievers, they say, 'What did God desire by this for a similitude?' Thereby, He leads many astray and thereby He guides many; and thereby He leads none astray except the wicked.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 2:28: Those such as break the covenant of God after its solemn binding, and such as cut what God has commanded should be joined; and such as do corruption in the land - they shall be the losers.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 2:29: How do you disbelieve in God, when you were dead, and He gave you life; then He shall make you dead, then He shall give you life, then to Him you shall be returned!
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 2:30: He it is Who created for you all that is in the earth; then He turned to heaven and levelled them seven heavens and He has knowledge of all things.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 2:31: And when your Lord said to the angels, 'I am appointing on earth a vicegerent', they said, 'What, will You appoint therein one who will do corruption therein and shed blood, while we glorify You with praise and sanctify You?'; He said, 'Assuredly, I know what you know not'.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 2:32: And He taught Adam the names, all of them; then He presented them to the angels and said, 'Now tell Me the names of these if you speak truly'.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 2:33: They said, 'Glory be to You! We know not except what You have taught us.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 2:34: He said, 'Adam, tell them their names'; And when he had told them their names He said, 'Did I not tell you that I know the Unseen in the heavens and the earth?, And I know what you reveal and what you were hiding.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 2:35: And when We said to the angels, ‘Prostrate yourselves to Adam; so they prostrated themselves, except Iblīs, he refused and disdained; and so he became one of the disbelievers.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 2:36: And We said, 'Adam, dwell and your wife in the Garden and eat thereof easefully where you desire; but do not come near this tree lest you be evildoers'.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 2:37: Then Satan caused them to slip therefrom and brought them out of what they were in and We said, 'Go down some of you an enemy to the other; and in the earth a dwelling shall be yours, and enjoyment for a while'.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 2:38: Thereafter Adam received certain words from his Lord and He relented to him; truly He is the Relenting, the Merciful.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 2:39: We said, 'Go down from it all together, yet there shall come to you from Me guidance, and whoever follows My guidance, no fear shall befall them, neither shall they grieve.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 2:40: As for the disbelievers who deny Our signs, those shall be the inhabitants of the Fire, abiding therein'.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 2:41: O Children of Israel, remember My favour wherewith I favoured you; and fulfil My covenant, and I shall fulfil your covenant; and have awe of Me.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 2:42: And believe in what I have revealed, confirming that which is with you; and be not the first to disbelieve in it.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 2:43: And do not obscure the truth with falsehood; and do not conceal the truth wittingly.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 2:44: And establish prayer, and pay the alms, and bow with those that bow.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 2:45: Will you bid others to piety and forget yourselves, while you recite the Book? Do you not understand?
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 2:46: Seek help in patience and prayer.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 2:47: who reckon that they shall meet their Lord, and that to Him they are returning.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 2:48: O Children of Israel, remember My favour wherewith I favoured you, and that I have preferred you above all the worlds;
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 2:49: and fear the day when no soul for another shall give satisfaction, and no intercession shall be accepted from it; nor any compensation be taken, neither shall they be helped.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 2:50: And when We delivered you from the folk of Pharaoh who were visiting you with evil chastisement, slaughtering your sons, and sparing your women; and for you therein was a tremendous trial from your Lord.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 2:51: And when We divided for you the sea, and We delivered you, and drowned Pharaoh's folk, while you were beholding.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 2:52: And when We appointed for Moses forty nights, then you took to yourselves the Calf after him, and you were evildoers.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 2:53: Then We pardoned you after that so that you might be thankful.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 2:54: And when We gave to Moses the Scripture and the Criterion, so that you might be guided,
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 2:55: And when Moses said to his people, 'My people, you have done wrong against yourselves by your taking the
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 2:56: calf; now turn to your Creator and slay one another; That, will be better for you in your Creator's sight'; He will turn to you ;
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 2:57: truly He is the Relenting, the Merciful.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 2:58: And when you said, 'O Moses, we will not believe you till we see God openly'; and the thunderbolt took you, while you were beholding.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 2:59: Then We raised you up after you were dead, so that you might be thankful.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 2:60: And We made the cloud overshadow you; and We sent down upon you manna and quails: 'Eat of the good things We have provided for you'; And they did not wrong Us, but themselves they wronged.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 2:61: And when We said, 'Enter this city, and eat freely therein wherever you will, and enter it at the gate prostrating, and say, 'exoneration', and We shall forgive you your transgressions and We shall give more to those who are virtuous'.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 2:62: Then the evildoers substituted a saying other than that which had been said to them; so We sent down upon the evildoers wrath from the heaven for their wickedness.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 2:63: And when Moses sought water for his people, We said, 'Strike with your staff the rock, and there exploded from it twelve fountains, each people came to know their drinking-place, 'Eat and drink of that which God has provided, and do not be degenerate in the earth, seeking corruption'.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 2:64: And when you said, 'Moses, we will not endure one sort of food; pray to your Lord for us, that He may bring forth for us of what the earth produces - green herbs, cucumbers, garlic, lentils, onions'; He said, 'Would you exchange what is better with what is lowlier?' 'Go down to a city, you shall have what you demanded'; And abasement, and wretchedness were cast upon them, and they incurred God's wrath; that was because they used to disbelieve the signs of God and slay prophets without right; that was because they disobeyed, and they were transgressors
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 2:65: Surely those who believe, and those of Jewry, and the Christians, and the Sabaeans, whoever believes in God and the Last Day, and performs righteous deeds - their wage is with their Lord, and no fear shall befall them, neither shall they grieve.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 2:66: And when We made a covenant with you, and We raised above you the Mount, 'Take forcefully what We have given you, and remember what is in it so that you might preserve yourselves'.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 2:67: Then you turned away thereafter, and but for God's bounty and His mercy towards you, you would have been among the losers.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 2:68: And verily you know that there were those among you who transgressed the Sabbath, and We said to them, 'Be apes, despised!'
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 2:69: And We made it an exemplary punishment for all the former times and for the latter, and an admonition to such as who fear.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 2:70: And when Moses said to his people, 'God commands you to sacrifice a cow', they said, 'Do you take us in mockery?' He said, 'I take refuge with God lest I should be one of the ignorant'.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 2:71: They said, 'Pray to your Lord for us, that He may make clear to us what she may be'.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 2:72: They said, 'Pray to your Lord for us, that He make clear to us what her colour may be'.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 2:73: They said, 'Pray to your Lord for us, that He make clear to us what she may be; the cows are all alike to us; and if God wills, we shall then be guided'.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 2:74: He said, 'He says she shall be a cow not broken to plough the earth, or to water the tillage, with no blemish on her'.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 2:75: And when you killed a living soul, and disputed thereon - and God disclosed what you were hiding,
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 2:76: so We said, 'Smite him with part of it'; God brings to life the dead, and He shows you His signs so that you might understand.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 2:77: Then your hearts became hardened thereafter, or even yet harder; for there are stones from which rivers come gushing, and others split so that water issues from them; and others come down in fear of God; And God is not heedless of what you do.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 2:78: Are you then so eager that they should believe you, seeing there is a party of them that heard God's word, and then tampered with it, and that, after they had comprehended it knowingly?
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 2:79: And when they meet those who believe, they say, 'We believe'; but when they go in private one to another, they say: 'Do you speak to them of what God has disclosed to you, so that they may thereby dispute with you before your Lord? Have you no understanding?'
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 2:80: Know they not that God knows what they keep secret and what they proclaim?
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 2:81: And there are some of them that are illiterate, not knowing the Scripture, but only desires and mere conjectures.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 2:82: So woe to those who write the Scripture with their hands then say, 'This is from God' that they may sell it for a small price.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 2:83: And they say, 'the Fire shall not touch us, save a number of days'.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 2:84: Not so; whoever earns evil and is encompassed by his transgression - those are the inhabitants of the Fire, therein abiding.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 2:85: And those who believe and perform righteous deeds - those are the inhabitants of Paradise, therein abiding.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 2:86: And when We made a covenant with the Children of Israel: 'You shall not worship any other than God; and to be good to parents, and the near of kin; and to orphans, and to the needy; and speak well to men; and observe prayer and pay the alms', then you turned away; all but a few of you, rejecting.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 2:87: And when We made a covenant with you: 'You shall not shed your own blood, neither expel your own from your habitations'.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 2:88: Then there you are killing one another, and expelling a party of you from their habitations, conspiring against them in sin and enmity, and if they come to you as captives, you ransom them; yet their expulsion was forbidden you.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 2:89: Those are the ones who have purchased the life of this world at the price of the Hereafter - for them the punishment shall not be lightened, neither shall they be helped.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 2:90: And We gave Moses the Scripture, and after him We sent successive messengers, and We gave Jesus son of Mary the clear proofs, and We confirmed him with the Holy Spirit, and whenever there came to you a messenger, with what your souls did not desire, you became arrogant; and some, you called liars, and some you slay?
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 2:91: And they say: 'Our hearts are encased'.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 2:92: When there came to them a Book from God, confirming what was with them - and they formerly prayed for victory over the disbelievers; but when there came to them what they recognised, they disbelieved in it; and the curse of God is on the disbelievers.
