Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 2:93: Evil is that for which they sell their souls; that they disbelieve in that which God has revealed, grudging that God should reveal of His bounty to whomever He will of His servants; and they were laden with anger upon anger; and for the disbelievers there shall be a humiliating chastisement.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 2:94: And when it was said to them, 'Believe in what God has revealed, they said, 'We believe in what was revealed to us', and they disbelieve in what is beyond that; yet it is the truth, confirming what is with them.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 2:95: And Moses came to you with clear proofs; then you took to yourselves the calf after him, and you were evildoers.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 2:96: And when We made a covenant with you, and raised over you the Mount, 'Take forcefully what We have given you, and listen', they said, 'We hear and disobey'; and they were made to drink the calf in their hearts on account of their unbelief.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 2:97: Say: 'If the Abode of the Hereafter with God is purely yours, and not for other people, then long for death - if you speak truly'.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 2:98: But they will never long for it, because of that which their own hands have sent before them.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 2:99: And you shall find them the people most covetous of life, and the idolaters; any one of them would love that he might be given life for a thousand years; yet, his being given life shall not budge him from the chastisement.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 2:100: Say: 'Whoever is an enemy to Gabriel - he it was that brought it down upon your heart by the leave of God, confirming what was before it, a guidance, and good tidings for the believers.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 2:101: Whoever is an enemy to God and His angels and His messengers, and Gabriel and Michael - then surely God is an enemy to the disbelievers'.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 2:102: And We have revealed to you clear proofs; and none disbelieves in them except the wicked.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 2:103: Why, whenever they make a covenant, does a party of them reject it? Nay, but most of them are disbelievers.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 2:104: When there came to them a messenger from God, confirming what was with them, a party of them who were given the Scripture have cast away the Scripture of God behind their backs, as though they did not know.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 2:105: And they follow what the devils used to relate Solomon’s kingdom: Solomon disbelieved not, but the devils disbelieved, teaching the people sorcery; and that which was revealed to the two angels in Babylon — Hārūt and Mārūt.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 2:106: Yet if only they had believed, and been fearful, verily, a reward from God would have been better, if they had but known.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 2:107: O you who believe, do not say, 'Observe us'; but say, 'Regard us', and give ear; and for disbelievers awaits a painful chastisement.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 2:108: Those disbelievers of the People of the Scripture and the idolaters, do not wish that any good should be revealed to you from your Lord, but God singles out for His mercy, whom He will; God is of bounty abounding.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 2:109: And whatever verse We abrogate or postpone, We bring [in place] a better, or the like of it; do you not know that God has power over all things?
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 2:110: Do you not know that to God belongs the kingdom of the heavens and the earth, and that you have none, besides God, neither protector, nor helper?
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 2:111: Or do you desire to question your Messenger as Moses was questioned, aforetime? Whoever exchanges belief for unbelief, has surely strayed from the even way.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 2:112: Many of the People of the Scripture long that they might make you disbelievers, after you have believed, from the envy of their own souls, after the truth has become clear to them; yet pardon and be forgiving till God brings His command; truly God has power over all things.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 2:113: And perform the prayer, and pay the alms; whatever good you shall offer for your own souls, you shall find it with God; assuredly God sees what you do.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 2:114: And they say, 'None shall enter Paradise except those who are Jews or Christians'.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 2:115: Nay, but, whoever submits his purpose to God, being virtuous, his reward is with his Lord, and no fear shall befall them, neither shall they grieve.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 2:116: The Jews say, 'The Christians stand on nothing'; and the Christians say, 'The Jews stand on nothing'; yet they recite the Scripture.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 2:117: And who does greater evil than he who bars God's places of worship, so that His Name be not invoked in them, and strives to ruin them?; such men might never enter them, save in fear; for them in this world is degradation; and in the Hereafter a mighty chastisement.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 2:118: To God belong the East and the West; whithersoever you turn, there is the Face of God.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 2:119: And they say, 'God has taken to Himself a son'; Glory be to Him! Nay, to Him belongs all that is in the heavens and the earth; all obey His will.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 2:120: Creator of the heavens and the earth; and when He decrees a thing, He but says to it 'Be', and it is.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 2:121: And they, who do not know, say, 'Why does God not speak to us?; Why does a sign not come to us?' So, spoke those before them, the like of what they say; their hearts are much alike.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 2:122: We have sent you with the truth, a bearer of good tidings, and warner.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 2:123: Never will the Jews be pleased with you, neither the Christians, not until you follow their creed, Say: 'God's guidance is the true guidance'.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 2:124: Those to whom We have given the Scripture, and who recite it with true recitation, they believe in it; and whoever disbelieves in it, they shall be the losers.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 2:125: O Children of Israel, remember My favour wherewith I favoured you, and that I have preferred you over all the worlds.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 2:126: And beware of a day when no soul shall for another be requited, and no compensation shall be accepted from it, nor any intercession shall benefit it, neither shall they be helped.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 2:127: And when his Lord tested Abraham with certain words, and he fulfilled them, He said: 'I make you a leader for the people'.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 2:128: And when We appointed the House to be a place of visitation for the people, and a sanctuary: 'Take to yourselves Abraham's station for a place of prayer'; and We made a covenant with Abraham and Ishmael: 'Purify My House for those that shall go round it and those that cleave to it, to those who bow and prostrate themselves'.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 2:129: And when Abraham said, 'My Lord, make this a land secure and provide its people with fruits; such of them as believe in God and the Last Day', He said, 'And whoever disbelieves, to him I shall give enjoyment, a little, then I shall compel him to the chastisement of the Fire - how evil a journey's end!'
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 2:130: And when Abraham raised up the foundations of the House, and Ishmael with him: 'Our Lord! Receive this from us.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 2:131: Our Lord! And make us submissive to You and, of our seed, a community submissive to You; and show us our holy rites, and relent to us.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 2:132: Our Lord! And send among them a messenger, one of them, who shall recite to them Your signs, and teach them the Book and Wisdom, and purify them; You are the Mighty, the Wise.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 2:133: Who therefore shrinks from the religion of Abraham, except he who fools himself? Indeed We chose him in this world, and in the Hereafter he shall be among the righteous.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 2:134: When his Lord said to him, 'Submit', he said, 'I have submitted to the Lord of the Worlds'.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 2:135: And Abraham enjoined upon his sons this, and [so did] Jacob, 'My sons, God has chosen for you the
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 2:136: religion, see that you die not save in submission.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 2:137: Or, were you witnesses when death came to Jacob? When he said to his sons, 'What will you worship after me?' They said, 'We will worship your God and the God of your fathers Abraham and Ishmael and Isaac, One God, to Him we submit'.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 2:138: That is a community that has passed away; theirs is what they have earned, and yours is what you have earned; you shall not be asked about what they did.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 2:139: And they say, ‘Be Jews or Christians, and you shall be guided’.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 2:140: Say: 'We believe in God, and in that which has been revealed to us, and revealed to Abraham, Ishmael, Isaac, Jacob, and the Tribes, and that which was given to Moses, and Jesus, and the prophets, from their Lord, we make no division between any of them, and to Him we submit'.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 2:141: And if they believe in the like of what you believe in, then they are truly guided; but if they turn away, then they are clearly in schism; God will suffice you against them; He is the Hearer, the Knower.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 2:142: The mark of God; and who has a better mark than God? And Him we worship.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 2:143: Say: 'Would you then dispute with us concerning God, and He is our Lord and your Lord? Our deeds belong to us, and to you belong your deeds, and to Him we are sincerely devoted'.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 2:144: Or do you say: 'Abraham, Ishmael, Isaac and Jacob, and the Tribes - they were Jews, or they were Christians?' Say: 'Have you then greater knowledge, or has God? And who does greater injustice than he who conceals a testimony received from God? And God is not heedless of what you do'.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 2:145: That is a community that has passed away; theirs is what they have earned, and yours is what you have earned; you shall not be asked about what they did.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 2:146: The fools among the people will say, 'What has turned them from the direction they were facing in their prayers formerly?' Say: 'To God belong the East and the West.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 2:147: Thus, We appointed you a midmost community that you might be witnesses to the people; and that the Messenger might be a witness to you, and We did not appoint the direction you were facing, except that We might know, who followed the Messenger from him who turned on his heels - though it were a grave thing, save for those whom God has guided; but God would never cause your faith to be wasted; truly, God is Gentle with people, Merciful.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 2:148: We have indeed seen you turning your face about in the heaven; now We will surely turn you to a direction that shall satisfy you.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 2:149: Yet if you should bring to those who have been given the Scripture every sign, they will not follow your direction, and you are not a follower of their direction; neither are they followers of one another's direction.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 2:150: Those to whom We have given the Scripture, they recognise him, as they recognise their sons; even though there is a party of them that conceal the truth, while they know.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 2:151: The truth comes from your Lord; then be not among the doubters.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 2:152: Every person has his direction to which he turns, so vie with one another in good works.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 2:153: From whatever place you issue, turn your face towards the Sacred Mosque; it is the truth from your Lord.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 2:154: From whatever place you issue, turn your face towards the Sacred Mosque; and wherever you may be, turn your faces towards it, so that there be not any argument from the people against you; excepting the evildoers among them; and do not fear them, but fear Me; and that I may perfect My grace upon you, and that you may be guided.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 2:155: As also We have sent among you, of yourselves, a messenger, to recite Our verses to you and to purify you, and to teach you the Book, and wisdom, and to teach you what you knew not.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 2:156: So remember Me, I will remember you; and be thankful to Me, and be not ungrateful towards Me.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 2:157: O you who believe, seek help through patience and prayer; surely God is with the patient.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 2:158: And say not of those slain in God's way: 'They are dead'; rather they are living; but you are not aware.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 2:159: Surely We will try you with something of fear and hunger, and diminution of goods and lives; yet give good tidings to the patient;
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 2:160: those who, when they are struck by an affliction, say, 'Surely we belong to God, and to Him we will return'.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 2:161: Upon those rest blessings and mercy from their Lord, and those - they are the truly guided.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 2:162: Truly Safā and Marwa are among the waymarks of God, so whoever makes the Pilgrimage to the House, or the Visitation, he would not be at fault, if he circumambulates them; and whoever volunteers good, God is Grateful, Knowing.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 2:163: Those who conceal the clear proofs and the guidance that We have revealed after We have shown them clearly in the Scripture - they shall be cursed by God and by the cursers,
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 2:164: Except those that repent, and make amends, and show clearly - them I shall turn [relenting; I am the Relenting, the Merciful.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 2:165: But those who disbelieve, and die disbelieving - upon them shall be the curse of God and the angels, and of people altogether.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 2:166: Abiding therein: the chastisement shall not be lightened for them, no respite shall be given them.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 2:167: Your God is One God; there is no god except Him, the Compassionate, the Merciful.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 2:168: Surely in the creation of the heavens and the earth, and the alternation of the night and day, and the ships that run in the sea with what profits men, and the water, God sends down from the heaven with which He revives the earth after it is dead, and He scatters abroad in it all manner of crawling thing; and the disposition of the winds, and the clouds compelled between heaven and the earth - surely there are signs for a people who comprehend.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 2:169: Yet there be people who take to themselves compeers besides God, loving them as God is loved; but those who believe love God more ardently; If he were to see those who did evil, when they see the chastisement, that the might altogether belongs to God, and that God is terrible in chastisement.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 2:170: When those who were followed disown their followers, and they have seen the chastisement, and the cords are cut away before them.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 2:171: And those who followed say, 'O, if only we might return again and disown them, as they have disowned us!' So, God shall show them their works, anguish for them! Never shall they exit from the Fire.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 2:172: O people, eat of what is in the earth, lawful and wholesome; and follow not the steps of Satan; he is a manifest foe to you;
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 2:173: he only commands you to evil and indecency, and that you should speak against God what you do not know.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 2:174: And when it is said to them, 'Follow what God has revealed', they say, 'No; but we follow what we found our fathers doing'.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 2:175: The likeness of those who disbelieve is as the likeness of one who shouts to that which hears nothing, save a call and a cry; deaf, dumb, blind - they do not comprehend.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 2:176: O you who believe, eat of the good things wherewith We have provided you, and give thanks to God if it be Him that you worship.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 2:177: He has only forbidden you: carrion, blood, the flesh of swine; what has been hallowed to other than God.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 2:178: Those who conceal what God has revealed of the Scripture, and sell it for a little price - they shall consume nothing in their bellies but the Fire; God shall not speak to them on the Day of Resurrection, neither purify them; and theirs is a painful chastisement.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 2:179: Those are they that have bought error at the price of guidance, and chastisement at the price of pardon; what makes them so patient for the Fire?
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 2:180: That is because God has revealed the Book with the truth; and those that are at variance regarding the Book are in schism, far removed.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 2:181: It is not piety, that you turn your faces to the East and to the West.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 2:182: O you who believe, prescribed for you is retaliation, regarding the slain; a free man, for a free man, and a slave for a slave, and a female for a female.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 2:183: In retaliation there is life for you, O people of pith, so that you might fear.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 2:184: Prescribed for you, when any of you is approached by death and leaves behind some good, is to make testament in favour of his parents and kinsmen honourably - an obligation on those that fear.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 2:185: Then if anyone changes it after hearing it, the sin shall rest upon those who change it; surely God is Hearing, Knowing.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 2:186: But if any one fears injustice or sin from one making testament, and so makes things right between them, then no sin shall be upon him; surely God is Forgiving, Merciful.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 2:187: O you who believe, prescribed for you is the Fast, just as it was prescribed for those that were before you so that you might guard yourselves.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 2:188: For days numbered; and if any of you be sick, or be on a journey, then a number of other days; and for those who are able to do it, a redemption: the feeding of a poor man.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 2:189: The month of Ramadān, wherein the Qur’ān was revealed, a guidance for the people, and as clear proofs of the Guidance and the Criterion; So let those of you, who are present at the month, fast it and if any of you be sick, or if he be on a journey, then a number of other days.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 2:190: And when My servants question you concerning Me, I am near; I answer the call of the caller when he calls to Me; so let them respond to Me, and let them believe in Me that they might go aright.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 2:191: Permitted to you, upon the night of the Fast, is to go in to your wives; they are a vestment for you, and you are a vestment for them; God knows that you have been betraying yourselves, and so He has turned to you ,
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 2:193: Consume not your goods between you in deception, and proffer them to the judges, that you may consume a portion of other people's goods in sin while you are aware.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 2:194: They will ask you about the new moons.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 2:195: And fight in the way of God with those who fight against you, but aggress not; God loves not the aggressors.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 2:196: And slay them wherever you come upon them, and expel them from where they expelled you; sedition is more grievous than slaying.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 2:197: But if they desist, surely God is Forgiving, Merciful.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 2:198: Fight them till there is no sedition, and the religion is for God; then if they desist, there shall be no enmity, save against evildoers.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 2:199: The sacred month for the sacred month; holy things demand retaliation; whoever commits aggression against you, then commit aggression against him in the manner that he committed against you; and fear God, and know that God is with the God-fearing.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 2:200: And spend in the way of God; and cast not your own hands into destruction; but be virtuous; God loves the virtuous.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 2:201: Fulfil the Pilgrimage and the Visitation to God; but if you are prevented, then
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 2:202: such offering as may be feasible, and do not shave your heads until the offering reaches its place.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 2:203: The Pilgrimage is in months well-known; whoever undertakes the duty of Pilgrimage during them, then no lewdness, nor wickedness, or disputing in the Pilgrimage.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 2:204: You would not be at fault if you should seek bounty from your Lord; but when you press on from ‘Arafāt, then remember God at the Sacred Waymark; and remember Him as He has guided you, though previously you were astray.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 2:205: Then press on from where the people press on, and seek God's forgiveness; God is Forgiving, Merciful.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 2:206: And when you have performed your holy rites, remember God as you remember your fathers, or yet more intensely.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 2:207: And there are others who say, 'Our Lord, give to us in this world good, and good in the Hereafter, and guard us against the chastisement of the Fire'.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 2:208: Those - they shall have a portion from what they have earned; and God is swift at reckoning.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 2:209: And remember God, during certain days numbered.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 2:210: And among people there is he whose speech in the life of this world pleases you; and who calls on God to witness what is in his heart; yet he is most stubborn in dispute.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 2:211: And when he turns his back, he hastens about the earth to do corruption there and to destroy the tillage and the stock; and God loves not corruption.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 2:212: And when it is said to him, 'Fear God', he is seized by vainglory in his sin.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 2:213: But there are other men who sell themselves, desiring God's pleasure; and God is Gentle with His servants.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 2:214: O you who believe, come, all of you, into submission; and follow not the steps of Satan; he is a manifest foe to you.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 2:215: But if you slip after the clear proofs have come to you, know then that God is Mighty, Wise.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 2:216: What do they wait for that God shall come to them in the shadows of clouds, and the angels? The matter is determined, and to God all matters are returned.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 2:217: Ask the Children of Israel how many a clear proof did We give them; whoever changes God's grace after it has come to him, God is severe in retribution.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 2:218: Decked out fair to the disbelievers is the life of this world; and they deride the believers; but those who fear shall be above them on the Day of Resurrection; and God sustains whomever He will without reckoning.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 2:219: People were one community; then God sent forth the prophets as bearers of good tidings and warners; and He revealed with them the Scripture with the truth that He might decide between people regarding their differences; and only those who had been given it, differed about it after the clear proofs had come to them out of insolence, one to another; then God guided those who believed to the truth, regarding which they were at variance, by His leave; and God guides whomever He will to a straight path.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 2:220: Or did you suppose that you should enter Paradise without there having come upon you the like of those who passed away before you? They were afflicted by misery and hardship and were so convulsed that the Messenger and those who believed with him said, 'When will God's help come?' Ah, but surely God's help is nigh.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 2:221: They will ask you about what they should expend.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 2:222: Prescribed for you is fighting, though it be hateful to you.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 2:223: They ask you about the sacred month, and fighting in it.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 2:224: Verily the believers, and those who emigrate, and struggle in God's way - those have hope of God's compassion; and God is Forgiving, Merciful.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 2:225: They ask you about wine, and divinatory arrows.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 2:226: on this world and the Hereafter.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 2:227: Do not marry idolatresses until they believe; a believing slavegirl is better than an idolatress, though you may admire her.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 2:228: They will ask you about the monthly period.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 2:229: Your women are a tillage for you; so come to your tillage as you wish; and offer for your souls; and fear God; and know that you shall meet Him; and give good tidings to the believers.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 2:230: Do not make God a hindrance in your oaths, to be pious and God-fearing; and to put things right between people; surely God is All-Hearing, Knower.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 2:231: God will not take you to task for a slip in your oaths; but He will take you to task for what your hearts have earned; and God is Forgiving, Forbearing.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 2:232: For those who forswear their women, a wait of four months; if they revert, God is Forgiving, Merciful.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 2:233: But if they resolve upon divorce; surely God is Hearing, Knowing.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 2:234: Divorced women shall wait by themselves for three periods.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 2:235: Divorce is twice; then honourable retention; or setting free kindly.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 2:236: If he divorces her, she shall not be lawful to him after that, until she marries another husband.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 2:237: When you divorce women, and they have reached their term, then retain them honourably, or set them free honourably; do not retain them in harm to transgress; whoever does that has wronged his soul; take not God's verses in mockery, and remember God's grace upon you, and the Book, and the wisdom He has revealed to you, to exhort you therewith; and fear God, and know that God has knowledge of all things.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 2:238: When you divorce women, and they have reached their term, do not debar them from marrying their husbands when they have agreed together honourably.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 2:239: Mothers suckle their children for two full years for such as desire to fulfil the suckling.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 2:240: And those of you who pass away, leaving wives, they shall wait by themselves for four months and ten.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 2:241: You would not be at fault regarding the proposal you present or hide in your hearts to women.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 2:242: You would not be at fault if you divorce women while you have not touched them, nor appointed any obligation for them; yet make provision of comforts for them honourably, the one of ample means, according to his means, and the needy man, according to his means - an obligation on the virtuous.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 2:243: And if you divorce them before you have touched them, and you have already appointed for them an obligation, then one-half of what you have appointed, unless it be that they make remission, or he makes remission, the one in whose hand is the knot of marriage; yet that you should remit is nearer to piety.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 2:244: Maintain the prayers and the middle prayer, and stand submissive to God.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 2:245: And if you are in fear, then standing, or mounted.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 2:246: And those of you who die, leaving wives, make testament for their wives, provision for a year; but if they go forth, you would not be at fault regarding what they may do with themselves honourably; God is Mighty, Wise.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 2:247: There shall be provision for divorced women, honourably - an obligation on those who fear.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 2:248: So, God makes clear His signs for you, so that you might understand.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 2:249: Have you not seen those thousands, who went forth from their habitations fearful of death? God said to them, 'Die!' Then He gave them life.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 2:250: So fight in God's way, and know that God is Hearing, Knowing.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 2:251: Who is he that will lend God a loan that is good, and He will multiply it for him manifold? God straitens and enlarges; and to Him you shall be returned.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 2:252: Have you not seen the council of the Children of Israel after Moses, when they said to a prophet of theirs, 'Send for us a king, and we will fight in God's way'.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 2:253: Then their prophet said to them, 'Verily God has raised up Saul for you as king'.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 2:254: And their prophet said to them, 'The sign of his kingship is that there will come to you the Ark.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 2:255: And when Saul went forth with the hosts, he said, 'God will try you with a river; whoever drinks of it, is not of me, and whoever tastes it not, he is of me, except for him who scoops up with his hand.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 2:256: So, when they went forth against Goliath and his troops, they said, 'Our Lord, pour out upon us patience, and make firm our feet, and grant us victory over the disbelieving folk!'
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 2:257: And they routed them, by the leave of God, and David slew Goliath; and God gave him the kingship and Wisdom, and He taught him such as He willed.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 2:258: These are the verses of God We recite to you in truth, and assuredly you are one of the Messengers [of God].
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 2:259: Those messengers some We have preferred above others; some there are to whom God spoke, and some He raised in rank.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 2:260: O you who believe, expend of what We have provided you with before there comes a day in which there shall be neither commerce, nor friendship, nor intercession.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 2:261: God, there is no god, except Him, the Living, the Eternal Sustainer.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 2:262: There is no compulsion in religion.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 2:263: God is the Protector of the believers; He brings them forth from the shadows into the light.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 2:264: Have you not seen him who disputed with Abraham concerning his Lord, that God had given him the kingship? When Abraham said, 'My Lord is He who gives life, and makes to die', he said, 'I give life and make to die'.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 2:265: Or such as he who passed by a city that was fallen down upon its turrets, he said, ‘How shall God give life to this now that it is dead?’.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 2:266: And when Abraham said, 'My Lord show me how You give life to the dead'.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 2:267: The likeness of those who expend their wealth in the way of God is as the likeness of a grain of corn that sprouts seven ears, in every ear a hundred grains; so God multiplies for whom He will; God is Embracing, Knowing.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 2:268: Those who expend their wealth in the way of God then do not follow up their expenditure with reminder of their generosity and injury, their wage is with their Lord, and no fear shall befall them, neither shall they grieve.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 2:269: Honourable words and forgiveness are better than a voluntary almsgiving followed by injury; and God is Independent, Forbearing.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 2:270: O you who believe, annul not your voluntary almsgivings with reproach and injury, as one who expends of his substance to show off to men and believes not in God and the Last Day.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 2:271: But the likeness of those who expend their wealth, seeking God's good pleasure, and to confirm themselves is as the likeness of a garden upon a hill; a torrent smites it and it yields its produce twofold; if no torrent smites it, then dew, and God sees what you do.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 2:272: Would any of you wish to have a garden of date-palms and vines, with rivers flowing beneath it, for him there is in it all manner of fruit, then old age smites him, and he has seed, but they are weak; then a whirlwind with fire smites it, and it is consumed.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 2:273: O you who believe, expend of the good things you have earned, and of what We have produced for you from the earth, and seek not the corrupt of it for your expending; for you would never take it yourselves without closing your eyes to it; and know that God is Independent, Laudable.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 2:274: Satan promises you poverty and enjoins you to indecency, but God promises you His pardon, and His bounty; and God is Embracing, Knowing.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 2:275: He gives wisdom to whomever He will, and he who is given wisdom, has been given much good; yet none remembers, but the people of pith.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 2:276: And whatever expenditure you expend, and whatever vow you make, surely God knows it.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 2:277: If you proclaim your voluntary almsgivings, it is a fine thing; but if you conceal them, and give them to the poor, that is even better for you; and it will absolve you of your evil deeds.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 2:278: You are not responsible for guiding them; but God guides whomever He will.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 2:279: For the poor, who are constrained in the way of God; and they are unable to journey in the land; the ignorant man supposes them, rich because of their abstinence; but you shall know them by their mark; they do not beg of men importunately.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 2:280: Those who expend their wealth night and day, secretly and openly, their wage awaits them with their Lord, and no fear shall befall them, neither shall they grieve.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 2:281: Those who devour usury shall not rise again, except as one whom Satan has made prostrate from touch; that is because they say, 'Trade is like usury': God has permitted trade, and forbidden usury.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 2:282: God effaces usury, but He augments voluntary almsgivings with interest.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 2:283: Those who believe and perform righteous deeds, and establish the prayer, and pay the alms - their wage awaits them with their Lord, and no fear shall befall them, neither shall they grieve.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 2:284: O you who believe, fear God, and give up the usury that is outstanding, if you are believers.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 2:285: But if you do not, then be warned of war from God, and His Messenger.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 2:286: And if any man should be in difficulties, then respite, till things are easier; but that you should give a voluntary almsgiving is better for you, did you but know.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 2:287: And fear a day wherein you shall be returned to God, and every soul shall be paid in full what it has earned; and they shall not be wronged.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 2:288: O you who believe, when you contract a debt, one upon another for a stated term, write it down; and let a writer write it down between you justly; and let not any writer refuse to write it down, as God has taught him; so let him write, and let the debtor dictate; and let him fear God his Lord, and not diminish anything of it.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 2:289: And if you are upon a journey, and you do not find a writer, then a pledge in hand.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 2:290: To God belongs all that is in the heavens and the earth.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 2:291: The Messenger believes in what was revealed to him from his Lord, and the believers; each one believes in God and His angels, and in His Books, and His messengers, 'we make no distinction between any of His messengers'.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 2:292: God charges no soul save to its capacity; for it is what it is has merited, and against it is what it has earned.

Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 2:2: (This is) the Glorious Book in which there is no chance of doubt.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 2:3: Those who believe in the unseen, and establish Prayer (fulfilling all its requisites) and spend (in Our way) out of what We have given them;
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 2:4: And those who believe in (all) that which has been revealed to you, and that which was revealed before you, and also have (perfect) faith in the Hereafter.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 2:5: It is they who follow guidance from their Lord, and it is they who shall achieve real success.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 2:6: Verily, those who have adopted disbelief, it is the same for them whether you warn them or you warn them not, they will not believe.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 2:7: Allah (as a result of their own choice) has set a seal on their hearts and their ears, and there is a blindfold (set) over their eyes.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 2:8: And amongst people there are (also) some who say: ‘We believe in Allah and the Last Day,’ whereas they are not (at all) believers.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 2:10: In their hearts is a disease.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 2:11: When it is said to them: ‘Do not spread disorder in the land,’ they say: ‘It is we who reform.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 2:12: Beware! (Truly) it is they who spread disorder, but they do not have any sense (of it) at all.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 2:13: And when it is said to them: ‘Believe as (other) people have believed,’ they say: ‘Shall we also believe (as those) fools have believed?’ Beware! (Certainly) they are themselves fools, but they do not know (their foolishness and low level).
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 2:14: And when they (the hypocrites) meet the believers, they say: ‘We (too) have believed,’ and when they meet their devils in private, they assure them: ‘We are certainly with you.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 2:15: Allah punishes them for their mockery, and lets them loose (so that they meet their fate).
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 2:16: These are the people who have purchased misguidance for guidance; but their trade did not yield any gain, and they did not know the way to a (gainful and profitable) bargain.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 2:17: Their example is like a person who lit a fire (in surrounding darkness), and when it brightened the environment, Allah took away their light and left them in total darkness.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 2:18: They are deaf, dumb and blind.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 2:19: Or their example is like a rain pouring from the sky wherein there are layers of darkness and thunder and lightning (as well).
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 2:20: It seems as if the lightning would snatch away their sight.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 2:21: O people! Worship your Lord, Who created you and (also) those who were before you, so that you become Godwary.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 2:22: (He is the One) Who spread out the earth for you as a floor, and erected the sky as a mansion, and showered water from the sky and brought forth with that (a variety of) fruits for your nourishment.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 2:23: And if you are in doubt about this (Book) which We have revealed to Our (exalted) servant, then produce only one chapter like this.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 2:24: But if you fail to do it—and you shall never be able to do it—then guard yourselves against the Fire whose fuel is human beings (the disbelievers) and stones (their idols), prepared for disbelievers.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 2:25: And, (O Beloved Prophet,) give glad tidings to those who believe and keep doing pious deeds that for them there are Gardens (of Paradise) beneath which streams flow.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 2:26: Indeed, Allah is not reluctant to narrate some example (for better comprehension), whether of a mosquito or something even more (disgusting) than that.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 2:27: (These disobedient people are those) who break the promise of Allah after having confirmed it, and break that (relationship) which Allah has ordered to be joined, and create disorder in the land.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 2:28: How can you deny Allah, whereas you were lifeless and He gave you life, then He will cause you to die and will again bring you back to life, and then to Him you will be returned?
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 2:29: He is the One Who created for you all that is in the earth.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 2:30: And (recall) when your Lord said to the angels: ‘I am about to place My vicegerent on the earth.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 2:31: And Allah taught Adam the names of all (things), and then presented them before the angels and said: ‘Tell Me the names of these things if you are true (in your assumption).
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 2:32: The angels (humbly) submitted: ‘Glory to You, You are Holy (free from every deficiency).
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 2:33: Allah said: ‘O Adam, (now) apprise them of the names of these things.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 2:34: And (also recall) when We commanded the angels: ‘Prostrate yourselves before Adam.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 2:35: And We ordained: ‘O Adam, reside you and your wife in this Paradise and eat of it, both of you, whatever you like and from wherever you will.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 2:36: Then Satan shook them from that place, and removed them from the (blissful) location where they were.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 2:37: Then Adam learnt some words (of humility and repentance) from his Lord.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 2:38: We said: ‘Leave it (Paradise and settle in the earth), all of you.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 2:39: And those who disbelieve and deny Our Revelations, it is they who shall be the inmates of the Fire.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 2:40: O Children of Ya‘qub (Jacob)! Recall My favours which I bestowed upon you and fulfil the promise (made) to Me, I shall fulfil the promise (made) to you.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 2:41: And believe in (the Book) that I have revealed (to My Messenger Muhammad [blessings and peace be upon him]), whilst it confirms (originally) that which you possess.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 2:42: And do not mix up the truth with falsehood, nor conceal the truth deliberately.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 2:43: And establish Prayer and pay Zakat (the Alms-due) regularly and kneel down (together) with those who kneel down.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 2:44: Do you command others for piety and forget yourselves, whilst you (also) recite the Book (of Allah)? So, do you not think?
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 2:45: And seek (Allah’s) help through patience and Prayer.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 2:46: (It is they) who are certain that they are about to meet their Lord and to Him are they going to return.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 2:47: O Children of Ya‘qub (Jacob)! Recall those favours that I bestowed upon you, and that I exalted you above all the people (of your age).
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 2:48: And fear that Day when no soul shall be able to pay any compensation on behalf of another.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 2:49: And (also recall) when We delivered you from Pharaoh’s people, who used to inflict severe torment upon you: they slaughtered your sons and kept your daughters alive.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 2:50: And when We parted the river (to rescue you) and (in this way) delivered you, and (on the contrary) We drowned Pharaoh’s people before your eyes.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 2:51: And (also recall) when We made an appointment with Musa (Moses) for forty nights.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 2:52: went into retreat), you took the calf as (your) god for worship, and you were no doubt awful transgressors.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 2:53: Then We pardoned you (even) after that so that you might give thanks.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 2:54: And (remember) when We bestowed upon Musa (Moses) the Book and the miracle distinguishing the truth from falsehood, so that you might take the path of guidance.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 2:55: And when Musa (Moses) said to his people: ‘O my people, no doubt you have (seriously) wronged your own souls in taking the calf (as your god).
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 2:56: And (remember) when you said: ‘O Musa (Moses)! We will never believe in you until we see Allah completely unveiled (before our eyes).
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 2:57: Then We brought you back to life after your death so that you pay (Us) thanks.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 2:58: And (recall) when We cast the shade of clouds over you (in the Tiha valley) and sent down for you manna and quails so that you might eat of the pure things We provided for you.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 2:59: And (remember) when We said: ‘Enter this city, and eat as much as you wish from wherever you desire, but enter (the city) gate prostrating and praying: (O our Lord!) We seek forgiveness (for all of our sins).
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 2:60: But (those) transgressors substituted some other phrase in place of that which was said to them.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 2:61: And (recall) when Musa (Moses) prayed for water for his people.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 2:62: And when you said: ‘O Musa (Moses), we cannot be content with only one kind of food (i.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 2:63: said (to his people): ‘Do you demand something inferior in exchange for something superior? (And if that is what you wish, then) go down to any city.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 2:64: Verily, those who have believed, and (those who were) Jews and Christians and Sabians, those (of them) who believe in Allah and the Last Day and act piously, there is for them their reward with their Lord.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 2:65: And (recall) when We took a firm promise from you and raised the Mount of Sinai high above you, so that you hold fast firmly what We have given you.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 2:66: Yet you turned back after this (promise and warning).
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 2:67: And (O Jews) certainly you know well those of you who violated (the injunctions concerning) the Sabbath (Saturday).
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 2:68: So We made this (event) a lesson of warning for their contemporaries as well as later generations, and (a source of) admonition for the pious.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 2:69: And (also recall) when Musa (Moses) said to his people: ‘Verily, Allah enjoins you to sacrifice a cow.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 2:70: (Then) they said: ‘Pray for us to your Lord that He may make clear to us what kind of cow (that) shall be.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 2:71: said: ‘Certainly, He ordains that the cow is to be neither old nor young (heifer), but in between (fully grown).
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 2:72: They (again) said: ‘Pray to your Lord for us that He may specify what her colour should be.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 2:73: (This time) they said: ‘Pray for us to your Lord that He may make clear to us what exact type of cow it is (because) the cow has become doubtful to us, and if Allah so wills, we shall indeed be guided aright.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 2:75: said:) Allah has ordained: ‘(That is not any inferior cow.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 2:76: And (recall), when you killed a man, then started disputing amongst yourselves (for its blame), and Allah was to unveil that event which you were concealing.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 2:77: Then We commanded: ‘Strike this (dead body) with a piece of this (cow).
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 2:78: Then (even) after this, your hearts hardened.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 2:79: (O Muslims!) Do you expect that they (the Jews) will believe in you, whereas amongst them were people of a group who heard the Word of Allah (Tawrat [the Torah]), then altered it (themselves) after understanding it, although they knew well (what the truth was and what they were doing)?
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 2:80: And (they have reached such a state that) when they meet the believers, they say: ‘We (too) have believed (in Muhammad [blessings and peace be upon him], like you),’ and when they are together in isolation, they say: ‘Do you tell them (the Muslims) that which Allah has unfolded to you (through the Torah in connection with the Prophethood and glory of the last of the Prophets, Muhammad, [blessings and peace be upon him]) so that they may use it in argument against you in the holy presence of your Lord? Do you not have (even this much) sense?’
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 2:81: Are they not aware that Allah knows full well all that they hide and all that they show?
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 2:82: And (some) amongst them (the Jews) are illiterate (as well) who do not know (even the bare minimum about the meaning and connotations of) the Book (except hearsay and false hopes).
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 2:83: So, a serious disaster awaits those who write the Book with their own hands, then say: ‘This is from Allah,’ just to earn a paltry price for that.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 2:84: And they (the Jews also) say: ‘The Fire (of Hell) shall not touch us except for a small number of days.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 2:85: Of course, he who adopts evil and is encompassed by his sins, it is they who are the inmates of Hell.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 2:86: And those who have believed and have done pious deeds, it is they who are the inhabitants of Paradise.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 2:87: And (remember) when We took a firm promise from the Children of Ya‘qub (Jacob): ‘Do not worship (anyone) besides Allah, and be kind to the parents and (do good to) the kindred and orphans and the needy.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 2:88: And when We took from you (this) solemn covenant (as well): ‘You shall not shed one another’s blood (amongst yourselves), nor shall you expel your people (from their homes and townships).
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 2:89: Yet it is you who are killing your own people and banishing a section of your own folk from their homeland, and (furthermore) helping (their enemies) with sin and transgression against them.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 2:90: It is they who have purchased the worldly life for the Hereafter.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 2:91: And surely We gave Musa (Moses) the Book (the Torah) and sent (many) Messengers after him in succession.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 2:92: And the Jews said: ‘Our hearts are wrapped up in covers.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 2:93: And when the Book (the Qur’an) came to them from Allah which (originally) validates that Book (the Torah) which was with them, whereas, before this, they themselves used to pray for victory over the disbelievers (through the intermediation of the Last Prophet, Muhammad, [blessings and peace be upon him] and the Holy Qur’an revealed to him), but when came to them the same Prophet (Muhammad [blessings and peace be upon him] along with the Book revealed to him, the Qur’an) whom they had (already) recognized, they denied him.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 2:94: How evil a bargain they made in exchange for their lives: that they deny the Book revealed by Allah merely begrudging that Allah bestows (His Revelation) out of His bounty upon any of His servants He wills.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 2:95: And when it is said to them: ‘Believe in this (Book) which Allah has (now) revealed,’ they say: ‘We believe only in that (Book) which was revealed to us,’ and they deny all other than that, whereas this (Qur’an) is (also) the truth, (and) confirms that (Book as well) which they possess.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 2:98: And when We took a firm promise from you, and We raised the Mount of Sinai high above you, (saying): ‘Hold fast to this (Book) which We have given you and listen (to Our commandment).
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 2:99: Say: ‘If in the sight of Allah the dwelling in the Hereafter is reserved for you alone, and not for others, then long for death (without any fear) if (you presume) you are truthful.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 2:100: But they will never long for it because of the sins (and atrocities) their hands have sent ahead (or have committed already) and Allah knows the wrongdoers full well.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 2:101: And you will certainly find them the most ambitious of mankind for longevity, (even) more than the polytheists aspire to attain.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 2:102: Say: ‘Whoever is an enemy to Jibril (
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 2:103: is doing injustice), because he is the one who has brought (the Qur’an) down upon your heart only by Allah’s command (which) confirms the preceding (Books) and contains (absolute) guidance and glad tidings for the believers;
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 2:104: He who is an enemy to Allah, His angels, His Messengers and Gabriel and Michael, verily Allah (too) is an enemy to (these) disbelievers.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 2:105: And certainly We have sent down to you luminous signs and none but the disobedient can deny them.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 2:106: And is it (not so) that every time they made a promise, a party of them disregarded it and threw it aside? The fact is that most of them do not believe.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 2:107: And (likewise), when there came to them from Allah the Messenger, (Muhammad, blessings and peace be upon him,) who (originally) confirms that Book which they (already) possessed, a party of the People of the Book threw the (same) Book of Allah (the Torah) behind their backs as if they did not know (it, whereas the same Torah had brought them the good news of the holy arrival of Muhammad the Last Prophet [blessings and peace be upon him]).
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 2:108: And they (the Jews) pursued that (magic) which the devils used to recite during the reign of Sulayman (Solomon).
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 2:109: But if they had believed and become Godfearing, (even a little) reward from Allah would have been far better (than all these things).
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 2:110: O believers! (Seeking the kind attention of the Holy Prophet) do not say: ‘ra‘ina (Pay attention to us),’ but submit (most humbly): ‘unzurna (Bless us with your benevolent gaze),’ and be all ears (towards his gracious discourse).
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 2:111: Neither the disbelievers amongst the People of the Book nor the polytheists like that any blessing should descend upon you from your Lord.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 2:112: When We abrogate some verse or cause it to be forgotten, (in either case) We bring (some other verse) better than or similar to it.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 2:113: Do you not know that the sovereignty of the heavens and the earth belongs to Allah alone, and that you have neither any friend nor any helper aside from Allah?
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 2:114: (O Muslims!) Do you also want to ask your Messenger (blessings and peace be upon him) questions the way Musa (Moses) was asked before? So he who changes belief for disbelief, for sure, loses the right path.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 2:115: Many of the People of the Book desire to turn you back to disbelief after you have believed because of the jealousy they have in their hearts, despite the fact that the truth has become evident to them.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 2:116: And (always) establish Prayer and pay Zakat (the Alms-due) regularly.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 2:117: And (the People of the Book) say: ‘No one will enter Paradise except he who is a Jew or a Christian.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 2:118: Yes, of course, he who submits his face to Allah (i.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 2:119: And the Jews say: ‘The Christians do not have their base upon anything (i.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 2:120: And who is more unjust than he who forbids remembering Allah’s Name in His mosques and strives to desolate them? It was not proper for them to enter the mosques but fearing (Allah).
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 2:121: And the east and the west (all) belong to Allah alone.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 2:122: And they say: ‘Allah has begotten a son for Himself,’ whilst He is Holy and Transcendent, far above (this).
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 2:123: He is the One Who has originated the heavens and the earth, and when He wills to (originate) a thing, He only says to it: ‘Be,’ and it becomes.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 2:124: And those who lack knowledge say: ‘Why does Allah not speak to us, or why does any sign not come to us (directly)?’ Likewise, the people before them also said words similar to theirs.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 2:125: (O Esteemed Beloved!) We have certainly sent you with the truth as a Bearer of good news and as a Warner.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 2:126: And the Jews and the Christians shall, by no means, be pleased with you until you follow their religion.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 2:127: (Also there are people) whom We gave the Book.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 2:128: O Children of Ya‘qub (Jacob)! Remember My favour that I bestowed upon you, and (especially) the supremacy which I awarded you over all the communities (of that age).
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 2:129: And fear that Day when no soul shall be able to recompense anything on behalf of another; nor shall any ransom be accepted from him (to deliver himself); nor shall any intercession benefit him (without Allah’s permission); nor shall they be helped (against the command of Allah).
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 2:130: And (call to mind) when the Lord of Ibrahim (Abraham) tested him with several commands which he fulfilled.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 2:131: And (remember) when We made this House (the Ka‘ba) a central place for mankind to turn to (and assemble) and a sanctuary for peace and (commanded:) ‘Make the place, where Ibrahim (Abraham) stood, a place of Prayer.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 2:132: And (recall) when Ibrahim (Abraham) prayed: ‘O my Lord, make it a city of peace and bless its residents who believe in Allah and the Last Day with a variety of fruits.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 2:133: And (recall) when Ibrahim and Isma‘il (Abraham and Ishmael) were raising the foundations of the Ka‘ba (praying:) ‘O our Lord, accept this (humble service) from us.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 2:134: O our Lord! Make both of us submissive to Your command; and raise out of our future generations an Umma (Community) exclusively obedient to You; and teach us our ways of worship (and Pilgrimage) and turn to us (with mercy and forgiveness).
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 2:135: O our Lord! Raise up from amongst them the (Last and the Exalted) Messenger (Muhammad [blessings and peace be upon him]), who shall recite to them Your Revelations, and teach them the Book and wisdom (logic and good judgment, making them gnostics of the divine secret), and purify and sanctify (their hearts and ill-commanding selves).
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 2:136: And who turns away from the religion of Ibrahim (Abraham) except he who has engaged himself in foolishness? And surely, We did choose him in the worldly life, and certainly in the Hereafter (too) he will be amongst the high-ranking intimate companions.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 2:137: And (recall) when his Lord commanded him: ‘Bow down (before Me),’ he submitted: ‘I bow down before the Lord of all the worlds.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 2:138: And Ibrahim (Abraham) enjoined, by way of will, the same thing upon his sons and (so did) Ya‘qub (Jacob): ‘O my sons, verily, Allah has chosen for you the (true) Din (Religion of Islam).
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 2:139: Were you present (at the time) when death approached Ya‘qub (Jacob) when he asked his sons: ‘Whom will you worship after (my passing away)?’ They said: ‘We shall worship your God, the God of your ancestors Ibrahim (Abraham) and Isma‘il (Ishmael) and Ishaq (Isaac), Who is the One and Only God; and we (all) shall remain obedient to Him.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 2:140: They were an Umma (community) who have passed away.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 2:141: And (the People of the Book) say: ‘Become Jews or Christians, then you will be guided aright.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 2:142: (O Muslims!) Say: ‘We believe in Allah and in that (Book) which has been revealed to us and (also) that which was revealed to Ibrahim (Abraham) and Isma‘il (Ishmael) and Ishaq (Isaac) and Ya‘qub (Jacob) and their children and those (Books) too which were given to Musa (Moses) and ‘Isa (Jesus) and (likewise) which were given to other Prophets by their Lord.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 2:143: Then if they (also) believe the way you have believed in Him, then they will (surely) be guided aright.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 2:144: (Say that we have taken on the colour from) Allah’s own colour, and whose colour is better than Allah’s? And we worship Him alone.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 2:145: Say: ‘Do you dispute with us about Allah, whereas He is (not only) our Lord but your Lord (too)? And to us are our works and to you are your works.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 2:146: (O People of the Book!) Do you say that Ibrahim (Abraham), Isma‘il (Ishmael), Ishaq (Isaac), Ya‘qub (Jacob) and their sons were either Jews or Christians?’ Say: ‘Who knows better, you or Allah?’ And who is more unjust than he who hides the testimony which is with him (in the Book) from Allah? And Allah is not unaware of your deeds.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 2:147: That was a community which has passed.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 2:148: Now the foolish will say: ‘What has turned away these (Muslims) from their Qibla (Bayt al-Maqdis in Jerusalem) to which they used to face (before)?’ Say: ‘The east and the west (all) belong to Allah alone.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 2:149: And, in the same way, (O Muslims,) We made you the best Umma (Community—fair to all with a tolerant, moderate and balanced outlook) so that you may bear witness to the people, and (Our exalted) Messenger (blessings and peace be upon him) bears witness to you.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 2:150: (O Beloved!) We have been watching your radiant face turning frequently towards heaven.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 2:151: And (even) if you bring every sign to the People of the Book, they will not follow your Qibla (direction of Prayer), nor will you follow their Qibla.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 2:152: And those to whom We have given the Book recognize (the Final) Messenger (the Venerable Muhammad [blessings and peace be upon him] and his glory and majesty) as they doubtlessly identify their own sons.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 2:153: (O listener!) The truth is from your Lord.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 2:154: And there is for everyone a (fixed) direction (i.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 2:155: And from wherever you move (on a journey), turn your face towards the Sacred Mosque (at the time of Prayer).
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 2:156: And from wherever you move (on a journey), turn your face towards the Sacred Mosque (at the time of Prayer) and, wherever you are, (O Muslims,) turn your faces towards it so that people may not get a chance to raise any objection against you, except those amongst them who exceed limits.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 2:157: Likewise, We have sent you (Our) Messenger (blessings and peace be upon him) from amongst yourselves who recites to you Our Revelations and purifies and sanctifies (your hearts and ill-commanding selves) and teaches you the Book and inculcates in you logic and wisdom and enlightens you (on the mysteries of spiritual gnosis and divine truth) which you did not know.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 2:158: So remember Me, I shall remember you.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 2:159: O believers! Always seek help (from Me) through patience and Prayer.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 2:160: And do not say about those who are slain in the cause of Allah that they are dead.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 2:161: And We will most certainly test you somewhat by means of fear and hunger and certain loss of wealth and lives and fruits.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 2:162: (They are the ones) who, when afflicted with some distress, say: ‘Indeed, to Allah we belong and to Him we shall return.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 2:163: It is they upon whom are bestowed successive blessings and mercy from their Lord.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 2:164: Verily, Safa and Marwa are indeed amongst the signs of Allah.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 2:165: Surely, those who conceal the manifest signs and guidance sent down by Us after We have revealed them clearly for the people in (Our) Book, it is they whom Allah curses (i.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 2:166: But those who repent, mend (their) ways and make known (the truth), so I (too) shall forgive them.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 2:167: Indeed, those who disbelieved (by concealing the truth), and left this world whilst they were disbelievers, upon them is the curse of Allah and of the angels and of all mankind.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 2:168: They shall be (held) under this (curse) forever.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 2:169: And your God is One God.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 2:170: Verily, in the creation of the heavens and the earth, and in the alternation of the night and the day, and in the ships (and vessels) which sail through the ocean carrying cargo profitable for the people, and in the (rain)water which Allah pours down from the sky, reviving therewith the earth to life after its death, and (the earth) in which He has scattered animals of all kinds, and in the changing wind directions, and in the clouds (that trail) between the sky and the earth, duty-bound (under Allah’s command)—certainly (in these) are (many) signs (of Allah’s Power) for those who put their reason to work.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 2:171: And there are some amongst the people who take others besides Allah as His partners and love them as it is Allah’s due alone.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 2:172: And when those (leaders of the disbelievers) who were followed would be disgusted with their followers and (they all) would see (Allah’s) torment and all their means and resources would be cut off,
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 2:173: And, (seeing this disgust, the polytheist) followers will say: ‘Would that we could get a chance (to return to the world), then we (too) would turn our backs on them as they have done to us (Today)!’ In this way Allah will show them their own deeds as remorse and regret.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 2:174: O mankind! Eat of that which is lawful and pure in the earth.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 2:175: He commands you only to do what is evil and immodest, and (also) that you should say about Allah that which you (yourselves) do not know.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 2:176: And when it is said to them (the disbelievers): ‘Follow that which Allah has sent down,’ they say: ‘(Nay) we shall rather follow the same (path) on which we found our ancestors,’ even though their ancestors had neither any sense nor any guidance.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 2:177: The example of inviting these disbelievers (to guidance) is like that of a person who calls out to such (an animal) as hears nothing except a shout or cry.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 2:178: O believers! Eat of those pure and clean things which We have provided for you, and give thanks to Allah if He is the One Whom you worship (and obey).
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 2:179: He has made unlawful for you only the dead animals and blood and the flesh of swine and the animal over which, whilst sacrificing, the name of someone other than Allah has been invoked.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 2:180: Indeed, those who conceal (those verses of the Torah) which Allah has revealed, and take in exchange for that a small price, eat nothing but fill their bellies with Fire.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 2:181: It is they who have purchased error for guidance and torment for forgiveness.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 2:182: This is so because Allah has revealed the Book with the truth.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 2:183: Righteousness is not merely that you turn your faces to the east or the west.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 2:184: O believers! Retribution (the law of equality in punishment) is prescribed for you in the case of those who are unjustly slain: a free man for a free man, a slave for a slave and a woman for a woman.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 2:185: And there is a (guarantee of) life for you in retribution (i.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 2:186: It is prescribed for you that when death approaches someone of you, and he leaves some property behind, then he is to make a will for (his) parents and kindred in a reasonable manner.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 2:187: Then he who alters this (will) after hearing it, its sin will be on those who alter it.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 2:188: So, if a person fears any partiality by a testator (for someone) or injustice (towards some other), and then brings about reconciliation amongst them, it shall be no sin on him.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 2:189: O believers! Fasting is prescribed for you as it was prescribed for the people before you so that you may become pious.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 2:190: (These are) a fixed number of days.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 2:191: The month of Ramadan (is the month) in which the Qur’an has been sent down as guidance for mankind containing clear signs which lead (to the straight road) and distinguishing (the truth from falsehood).
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 2:192: And, (O Beloved,) when My servants ask you about Me, (tell them:) ‘I am near.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 2:193: It is made lawful for you to approach your wives during the nights of the fasts.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 2:194: And do not eat up one another’s wealth amongst yourselves through injustice, nor take wealth to the authorities (as a bribe) so that, this way, you may (also) swallow a portion of others’ wealth unfairly, whilst you are aware (that this is a sin).
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 2:195: (O Beloved!) People ask you about the new moons.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 2:196: And fight (in defence) in the cause of Allah against those who impose war on you.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 2:197: And (during war) kill (the aggressing and combating disbelievers) wherever you find them, and drive them out (through military operation by the state) from where they drove you out.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 2:198: But if they desist, then surely Allah is Most Forgiving, Ever-Merciful.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 2:199: And keep fighting against them until the disruption and mischief is totally eliminated and the Din (Religion) practically becomes subservient to Allah alone (i.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 2:200: A sacred month is the requital of a sacred month, and (other) sacred things also requite one another.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 2:201: And spend in the cause of Allah; and do not cast yourselves into destruction with your own hands; and adopt righteousness.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 2:202: And accomplish (the ceremonies of) ±ajj (Pilgrimage) and ‘Umra (Visitation) for Allah.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 2:203: days) and for seven days on returning from ±ajj, making ten days (fasting) in all.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 2:204: Some months are appointed for ±ajj (Pilgrimage: Shawwal, Dhu al-Qa‘da and first ten days of Dhu al-Hijja).
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 2:205: And it is no sin on you if you (also) seek your Lord’s bounty (through trade during the ±ajj days).
